o6KhZVf4ReZVaFJVA208XQ.text: Round 1, Question 1: What restaurant has more beer than you can shake a stick at, the best beer cheese soup I've ever had and runs trivia on Tuesday nights?  Round 1, Question 2: How many different beers does a Flying Saucer U.F.O. club member need to drink to get a plate on the wall?  Round 1, Question 3: Who would you rather have guide you on which of the delicious libations you should try next than a friendly, knowledgeable gal in knee socks and a short skirt?  Answers: The Flying Saucer, 200, Nobody  The Saucer is routine stop for me, both for dinner and to just go have a beer and play some trivia. I couldn't, in good conscience, give it 5 stars because there are only a few things on the food menu that pique my interest (you MUST try the aforementioned beer cheese soup and the rocket tots!) and I have a thing against their pizza, though the slice my roommate ordered last week looked tastier than what I remember. Food is in the $5-$15 dollar range and beers run the scale from $5 on up.   Whether you are a lager lover, all about ale, or drool over dopplebock The Flying Saucer has many an option for you, so come on down and try one or two...hundred.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. The list changes every Sunday but always has solid $3 NC pints.

CPEiRleAFhE2t4tFWJ-aig.text: Having been to my first Flying Saucer via Houston I just had to see if Charlotte's location could meet or exceed that one.    I noticed the moment I walked in that the interior is acutally a little smaller but decorated almost identically.  Plates on the ceilings, booths along the wall and large sofa and chairs for lounging.  I really want to come back and just sit in those chairs and drink some cold beverages.  The food is a little better than bar food, although my girlfriend was a bit robbed when it comes to value of her roast beef sandwich she ordered.  Personally I love the rocket tots and the space club I got was delicious.  Now for the most important part the beer.  Yes, this place has tons of it and while I really wanted to take a run for getting my own plate on the wall, the location of this place is just too far from my house for me to really give it a go.

liW4hve8r-QLqOa6MFEfvQ.text: My advice - come here for the beer if you're in the University area, but skip the food.  Flying Saucer does have an amazing selection of beer, especially great beers on tap I'm not sure how many they have, but it's more than 30).  On certain days, you can pay $3-4 and get some sort of mystery beer.  What can I say - I love the mystery of it!  I got a Mexican Logger and thought it was pretty good.  Their menu has pretty standard bar-fare, with sandwiches, wings, and pizza.  Their pretzels were decent, but I had a River Rocket sandwich and was thoroughly unimpressed.  For the portion sizes and quality, their food is seriously overpriced.  One Sunday, my partner and I came in while he got an oil change.  It was probably a little before noon, and we came here because we thought breakfast places would be busy.  We intended to just get lunch, but lo and behold, we say people with plates and breakfast food on them.  Not knowing anything about it and asked the waitress, who did not tell us much except that apparently it is $11 if you are not a member.  It turns out this was a TERRIBLE idea.  So, I asked if they had coffee, which they did - SERVED IN A REGULAR BEER GLASS.  It was a very weird situation for us.  All the food on it was cold, it had only eggs, sausage, potatoes, and some muffins.  First off, it was GROSS.  Second, there was barely anything left on it and they were not refilling it (when we left, it was all gone).  It would have been nice for our waitress to tell us this before we ordered, but she looked like she could not be bothered.  I probably would have complained, but we decided instead to pay and leave.  It was a lesson learned to check the buffet before just blindly ordering.  Another family came in afterward for the buffet, which turns out had no food on it by that time.  I can't believe the waitress did not warn us of this before we ordered.  Because of this last experience, I don't think I'll ever go back.  I have no doubt Sunday afternoon is just a bad time to come, but this visit just completely soured me on the place.  They really have nothing here I can't get somewhere I like better.

wMrbvxcamFloSSB8meY59w.text: Stopped at the Saucer for dinner with some good friends before we headed out to a show at the amphitheater. I've snacked here before but usually have a liquid dinner since there's so many beers on tap. I grabbed a Purple Haze, on special for $3 (woot woot!) and we ordered rocket tots for an app. The tots come filled with cheesy goodness and served with jalapeno sour cream for dipping - delicious and just a bit of kick! And with me being a sour cream fiend, that definitely helped my opinion on these.  I ordered a turkey burger with pepper jack cheese and a side salad. Both were quite tasty and the burger was nice and juicy. My friend order her burger with a side salad and received fries instead but the waitress came over to check on us and quickly corrected it. Great service here! The food was a bit slow, which wasnt a big deal since we had the time, but my friend Bryan mentioned it's good food but always tends to take a bit long to make it to the table.  Only thing downside about Flying Saucer is all the tables and booths are very close together. With it being busy last night, it was a bit of a maze weaving through it all to get to the bathroom. But other than that, great hang out, always a beer on special and our server was very knowledgeable and friendly!

SEr3iTbwOHSbq_djkAfb6A.text: So I am a fan of the saucer.  I have a plate on the wall and an on my way to number two.  Great place for beer specials, to taste things you would not normally have the opportunity to taste and just hang out with friends and meet people.  In fact, met two of my closest friends there.  The food is better than 'typical' pub food but should not be your purpose for going to the saucer.  They have an outside deck which is great.   The bar maids are are for the most part really friendly and helpful.  They have great deals most of the days.  Glasses on Wednesdays, Tuesday they have $2.50 draft specials, new releases.  They have great guests there.  Got to meet and drink with the founder of Avery beers.  If you make it a habit, they will get to know you and you will be treated like family.

SIgMaSY3sorbViJLS0m2Ig.text: I lived so close to here for two years, and I waited until I moved 1000 miles away before I even went.  If you love beer it's the place to go!  And Monday nights are cheap!  I'm so glad Fat Tire came to NC, now I just need it in Boston!   The food is pretty good and the atmosphere is great for a group of friends having a few beers.  If you are looking for a great selection of beer, definitely check it out.  I wish I could try their beer club or whatever, but no time!  I would love a glass!

-6sYM_k6K36_aDxmv5czdQ.text: Based off the overall review & menu we choose to stop for lunch after we completed a 5k Foam Fest.  We received very bad service from Hannah and the manager didn't even bother to stop by and check on our table after we had to send back two of the Hippie Burgers because they were cold and ask 3 times for my son's wings to be brought out.  Two people in our party had finished eating before we received our remade Hippie Burgers and fries.  My son's wings were brought out AFTER the remade veggie burgers.  They were NOT busy, 4 tables in the whole place.  Very Disappointed after reading the other reviews.

vZ8waxoHd50EUsLRq15MvA.text: I have been going here for about a year now, and it has become the Saturday afternoon hang out.  The best thing about this place is their beer selection.  They keep well over 100 different beers tap/bottle at all times.  If you enjoy trying new beers then look no further this place is for you, so join the club.  The food is decent, and what you would expect from a place like this, burgers, sandwiches, apps, ect.  The atmosphere is awesome and you will not be disappointed.  They try and have different events at least once a month which is nice if you are a regular it keeps things interesting.  The staff is very kind and always knows exactly what my wife wants to eat and drink.  The one thing I am disappointed in is their "health score" and I hope they bring it up.

qOd0HutHRtz7uUmDbKP7Zw.text: Great beer selection and the staff is very friendly! I had the pretzel and it was fresh and so tasty. I'll definitely be back to try some of their other food selections and beers.

AJ2ZkemKpdV9OMApUSWHxA.text: Flying Saucer is the Taj Mahal of beer gardens. Each time I've visited, the beer selection seems to have grown or something has been added that wasn't previously available to the human race.   The walls are lined with plaques from local Pro Beer Drinkers. You can register your beer-capades and work your way up to earning your own plaque. Sounds like grounds for a great DYL, am I right?!   I've enjoyed most every nook of this fountain-esque beer haven. Great outdoor seating, cozy inside seating and the bar is long and hospitable. Here's a tip: order the pretzel. Oh, man. I can't think of a better pairing of food/beer. Salty, warm, chewy, soft pretzel with melty, melty cheese. Throw in a tall German beer and it's like being 21 all over again. What a treat.   This is the premier establishment to grab a craft or import beer north of Uptown. Can be overrun with UNCC students and other beer fanatics. Sometimes difficult to find a table for large parties. Absolutely love this joint and always stop in for a quick brew if in the area! Cheers!

k5XCI8OXis5Fq_R8IFAjdg.text: Not bad.  Had a birthday celebration here with my large group of friends. Overall, not bad.  Place - far north of Charlotte. It was a bit of a drone, coming from the South Park area. The venue inside was just as I have remembered in Houston, with all the saucer decor. It was packed on a Saturday night. Thankfully, my friends and I managed to grab a table!  Service - out waitress was attentive and brought us out what we had asked. So she gets an A+  Selections - they have a whole bunch of beers in bottles and taps. I chose this place for their Linderman's Framboise -- which they ran out that day! Man, talk about my luck :( The waitress was kind enough to suggest other beers.. She missed the first one (didn't like the beer much), but got it on the second one (better suggestion).  Sorry, forgot what those beer names were.  Price - decently priced. At least they were not over $10 for a beer like other places. So this is definitely an establishment I would revisit someday.  Music - one live man guy playing the guitar was cool. Played various music of 90s, 00s, and etc.

rhpR_VcCPE7UKlN-O04ncg.text: What can I say, I have been a fan of Flying Saucer for awhile. This is the first time we have been at this location and it was a perfect stop in our travels. We sat at the bar and the bartender was extremely friendly. Of course their beer list is extensive and has something for just about any beer lover. I like that they categorize their beers by styles. I hate searching and searching for a beer to try in an unorganized list. I ended up getting a sour and it was the perfect treat for the summertime heat! The bartender was also very gracious in allowing us to taste several beers we had never heard of and we chatted a bit about our favorites. My husband got the bahn mi for dinner and he said the pork was very dry, unfortunately he used my blue cheese from my wings to give it a little more pep. It has a really great atmosphere and I am thankful I don't live close to one, because we would be competitive in trying all the beers we could.

QIQ36IhGGz0JoyqaBtyxeA.text: They have tons and tons of beer options available and revolving specials.  Once you hit a certain amount of beers you get a plate with your name added to the wall or ceiling.  I am not quite sure as to how many it takes but it will take quite a few trips.  Their soft pretzels and cheese are awesome!  The pretzels are tender, soft, and salty.  It makes any beverage complete.  They have trivia on Tuesday nights and it's not any run of the mill music or movie trivia, it requires smarts and even smarter friends!

hqHN4JSkgLXuMKJjrDmykw.text: We have been coming here for several years and have never been disappointed with the food or service. Lauren's Goat Cheese salad is perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. Always great beers on tap.

8svq7JVjQt1kTF42hrmeTw.text: Korean meat ball dish was not Korean.  It might have been Mexican. I suspect they stole it that from ikea and put soysause  on it.   Very good appetizers. Excellent beer selection and knowledgable staff. Pretzels were amazing.  Waitress was kinda rude and very .... What you call it.... Stuck up.  Maybe they were having a bad day.

H963FnawmKA7hrc5ZjRRtw.text: Awesome beer selection. Try the beer cheese soup.

BDTcqFYfm0RAjS81HTwWUA.text: This is BY FAR one of my favorite places to go in Charlotte. My personal favorites are the soft pretzel and the brat-con-queso. The staff is always friendly and the food is pretty good overall.  What really blows you away is the beer selection. Major names, micro-brews, locals, and imports grace a MASSIVE beer list. I would guess that at any one time this place has at least 50-60 beers on tap, many of them local micros.  Great spot to watch football too, but get there early as seats tend to fill fast and customers spend all day in their booths.

3zG81vG2AOY38r5vN8BFCQ.text: I'm not a beer drinker which might be horrifying to some that I even go here... But I'm addicted to the pretzels and for the first time the other night I tried actual food -Hippie burger was surprisingly delicious! Had no idea it wasn't a meat patty it's so flavorful and filling! (Newly vegetarian going on 3months and have had a lot of disappointing vegetarian and vegan options elsewhere) this burger was a pleasant surprise

gKL_hvBql9P1vjtVGQuVvg.text: I love the Saucer. The beer is great, the company is diverse to say the least, the staff is very groovy, and the food is good. Their burgers are really good, as are the rocket tots.  I am never disappointed when I leave, only when I can't go!

ePb_n0HdMe9ziMHH_yXygw.text: Our experience here has always been great!! Most of the wait staff is exceptional but Ashleigh Parella is the stuff!! We won't sit anywhere else but for her to take care of us!! Also Chris is an awesome manager!! Love all around!! Beers are off the chain and food is above bar food standards

c0mvnRTcANhMwvKy_xFz8Q.text: Update:  Was contacted by the Manager thro Yelp to say that this was an honest mistake and they'll refund the extra amount.  Everyone deserves a second chance.

n-ytYpvpROKP2UmRyH2SxA.text: My favorite after work spot! Great service, drinks and food! Fellow Beerknurd UFO member

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States

LTPtn9SAmg6FE1Dv3hm5wg.text: The only flying you should be doing here is flying right past the place. Do not stop in for a drink, do not pass go, do not collect $200.  Food: Typical bar food at reasonable prices. The food is actually good, but where the Flying Saucer shines is their large beer selection. This is one of the largest and most diverse beer selections that I have ever seen. I just wish the menu would distinguish between beers on tap and beers served in a bottle.  Service: This is where the Flying Saucer just crashes and dives. I have been here twice. The first time was with a large group, and the service was ok, but this past time, it was just downright terrible. A friend and I came in, were told to sit wherever we wanted, and then had to wait ten minutes before being finally served. The place was not packed, and the servers were not busy at all. One server even seemed to be so bored that she was standing in the corner massaging a customer's back. When we finally did order, we were served the wrong food and even got the wrong beer. When I brought this up to the server, the response was "Oh, ya. I figured you didn't order that." Ok...then why did you bring it to me?  I will not be back. Flying Saucer, I suggest you land and perform some maintenance before taking off on another flight.

we2UAPeDhsufUzNiKbbxNA.text: A great selection of beers, one of the largest I have seen. The food is great but could use more of a selection

u0OXJa8-QZzYFcPTDiA3ng.text: Where do I begin to describe this place? I always get so thirsty, and this place always leaves me quenched and drunk which is what I love. Sunday and Monday nights are hopping because of the $3.50/pint specials. The wait staff is friendly and the bar tenders are extremely nice. Many people who go here have a plate on the ceiling. The taps change daily and very fast which keeps things exciting every time I come back here. I would bring my own 65 year old father here who hasn't drank since his wedding day to drink wonderfully crafted draft beer here. WWCKD ? Also I love this place and it might love me back.

T22DLOHlPZOnRoAjZSdpvQ.text: Poor service, the heavy set brown haired manager was the most rude and incompetent person I've ever met in my life. Never visit this location unless you want nasty stares and terrible customer service.

2zgfpHWAs3KMhpA48MI-1w.text: My favorite spot to grab a drink in the University area. Great atmosphere, plenty of TVs (and beer), and the food is actually fantastic.  There is a Flying Saucer in Raleigh that my friends and I would frequent in college, and this location makes me feel like I'm right back there. Located right of of N. Tryon right across from the UNCC campus, this Flying saucer has plenty indoor and outdoor seating. Parking is sometimes an issue, but if so you can always park in the golf course parking lot right next door.  I've recently had the grilled cheese and the cheese pizza. Honestly, anything I ever order food-wise is great. Actual quality bar food, and of course a plethora of beers on tap.

9tnzz-SlwbxJ9jihs7YF7g.text: So many taps. So many bottles. What a collection!!!  Need an excuse to get out?! Hangout?! Play trivia?!  Well look no further! The place is pretty big. Tvs scattered throughout.  Outdoor seating if you can find it. Servers are very nice. And can give good suggestions. The menu is many many pages.  And it seems they keep it well stocked. They also have beers on fire sale... meaning time to get rid of it so they can bring something new in! So many to try! Food is typical. Good but nothing to rave about.  Good portion sizes too.  They have trivia on Tuesday nights. It's challenging too. Very fun. Three rounds....   Throughout October they are doing different decades... so brush up before you go!

4ev2kh_j1HJJpWkeaHh2Xw.text: Great for beer drinkers. Liquor drinks are good too but try to stick to the beer. You have a better selection to choose from :) great atmosphere.

WGxKogyY2q__M90Cd_6qxA.text: We sat for over an hour waitress showed up 3 times to take our order and replace water,  almost 2 hours and no food, 1 beer, and we left.  Service was worst that red lobster.  Will never be back.

AGAwUxOTTYikKXuLVtqvxA.text: What a cool and unique bar. Great selection and the staff was friendly. The place had an energy to it but it wasn't so loud that you couldn't carry on a conversation. We ordered appetizers and sandwiches and everyone like what they got. Lots of fun reading the quotes of the 200 glass awards on the ceiling and walls. Check it out and you will be amazed as I was. This is the kind of place you hope to find when you are new to the area.

sxi8pnaOPPuZFe7bIel8eA.text: The food was decent but was just bar/pub food with a German twist to some. The service was good. Also there was a hugeee beer list so it's a good place to grab a drink but the food didn't stand out.

biCIqwtlyjKgIS8ZuSQnRQ.text: Great selection of beers.... Best I've seen, even in Asheville or Raleigh. And you know what? Their pizza is very, very good. Good times with great folks.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. Just a few of the taps!

cAqEIfkbVYGQhfXOFmANPA.text: This is a racist establishment that reflects the political environment. My husband cracked his ID pulling out of his wallet earlier today. We are both clearly in our mid 30's but he's Latino so they gave him a hard time and refused to serve him alcohol. The manager didn't come over to talk with us or ask us for other forms of ID, either. We may be brown but our money is green, just like everyone else's. We went across the street to Ale's University and were served without an issue.

dex15PnYFKQFqJNcKTBmNA.text: I love the pizza, but when I tried to pick up my order they forgot to place my order and I had to wait an additional 20 minutes.

rMS2kYDDec0YtGCLJ8QbVQ.text: Well dang, why can't we get one of these in Greenville?? I'm in love and this long distance relationship is gonna be tough but I'll manage. One visit and I'm hooked. Unfortunately, my first two choices were out but the Dark Side Flight was really good and I normally shy away from any darks as they are too thick and heavy for me but they had a decent selection offered and of course, Guinness was on there. Can't go wrong with that Mac Daddy. Alright, enough reading, just go and knock some back!

U9YUw17qBKmS9_0LcEjgtw.text: I am a HUGE fan of the Flying Saucer brand. Lots of beer and great food! It is a chain, but it feels more like a local bar.   We came here on Saturday evening, since we were in the University area. (I wish there was one walking distance to our apartment in Uptown!!!). We sat at one of the small semi-circle booths....these are cute cause we can sit side by side and watch football. There was a wheat beer on special so I immediately ordered that without even looking at who brewed it. It was delish so I drank that the rest of the night. My husband ordered various beers throughout the night. They have so many beers on tap! We are huge microbrewery fans and love to support local breweries....so we usually stick to the NC ones (Lonerider, Natty Greens, NODA, etc, etc, etc).   The food is basically German with some American dishes. We ordered the soft pretzals with beer cheese. We have ordered this many times in the past and new it was a winner. Dang those pretzals are awful for you but so good. The beer cheese is some of the best we ever tasted AND we recently went to Germany!   Spent the evening drinking beer, watching football, and playing darts. It was great! Service was spot on as well

BsTa3Lb2_C9bgOYcj1l2yA.text: This is a great food and bar. Great staff and top notch food! Awesome beer choices and a strong bar as well. I love coming here when in Concord.  Great wings, great queso, good pretzels - What!! I am a simple person!!

RFN0_l51jTO5ZjT7jhjFag.text: This place is awesome!! There's one in Raleigh too. Dog friendly outside with lots of craft beers to choose from. Loaded rocket tots are yummy!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States

YgWtM1Etm1QlsC_hHaquCw.text: Came up from Atlanta for a show. This place felt like home. Kaleigh, Ashley and all the staff treated us awesomely. Played darts with some locals, made friends, and had great beer! 10/10 would do again (we actually went back the next day).

3GmefPIsFwt3TZP0Rrd73g.text: Tuesday night trivia is so much fun here!  You should probably sit the near the front...the sound in the back is not so good.  The winners get a $50 gift certificate to the restaurant.  They can be quite communist about smart phone users, so serious trivialists only please!  My only gripe is that they take too long in between questions; 3 rounds of trivia takes about 2 1/2 hours!!

sVLHjDP2FfN2y9gDtkIJ5w.text: Love this bar and the idea. Tons of beer and interesting people.

Ytm1NXZoHGjVGCjzJDLHFA.text: The Flying Saucer offers great beer, great food, and good service. Most of the waitstaff is knowledgeable about the beer selections they offer, which is a nice touch. They have an incredible goat cheese salad, and the kitchen is very accommodating for substitutions and add-ons to the menu. Overall, a great place for casual dinner and drinks.

GHeQ8d5GEOU_pqqHIY6vaw.text: Pretzels are sooo good. Beware the mustard has horseradish and your nose will work WAY Better. Great pizza but Damn, the beer selection is off the chain. Doin it again and again.

zvNokRPmkwzc2seSHl3ZLw.text: Service was lacking and food came out wrong. When we received our food, the chicken was burnt and shepherds pie had no flavor. This was during a lunch service, when it was not crowded. No offer to comp food and no apology. Would not recommend this restaurant to anyone!

rSJ8ksbmWczZ2pvqJjhlDQ.text: Waited on by a Beer Goddess!  She knew the correct answer to every question, steered our menu choices, & knew how to handle gluten issues.  Usinger brats delicious, big dipper sandwich, pizza, & hippy hollow all likewise!  Wish they were in my neck of the woods.  Taco Mac would be out of biz!!

GmYm5IlQ9FS1rQnMTrIJdQ.text: Love it!  Huge beer selection and great bar food.  Raunchy Trivia and warm soft pretzels.  Plus lots of attractive bar maids!

SCadKnv-QodhqxIQUcxa3A.text: Beer selection:  amazing.  Location:  across the street from my office, so, highly convenient.  Food:  not so amazing.  Well, except for the Sheboygan side-by-side with the hot German potato salad.  It's the closest thing to Wisconsin you can get in Charlotte.

7l07L8jZ7DJqrY5IXGyWXg.text: About 8 of my friends wanted somewhere unique to go and have a few different beers to try and we ended up at the Saucer.  Friday night was a great night to go, was busy, but not packed and our service was great - even with a waitress in training tagging along!  The beer selection was amazing and they had some great specials ( I was able to partake in a pumpkin beer for the first time for just 4 bucks  :) )   I had an order of nachos and this was the one disappointment of the evening...the sauces they came with were great, but the nachos themselves were just kinda meh.  Overall it was a 4 star experience.

tgvHIqVOqm3bVgAMX4bwYg.text: This is a very cool bar with great beer, good eats and helpful staff.  The only negative side to this bar is that it gets pretty busy because there is only one in town.  But, there are lots of bar seats, tables, big comfy leather chairs, and a huge outdoor patio.  My last visit was a Wednesday night around 6pm.  There wasn't an empty seat in the house but It worked out well for me because I kicked my date's ass in darts!  I've never really had dinner here but I've had the pretzel and it was really yummy!  I would definitely be a regular here if it was closer to my home.

uXrdUoEcof_TUjiYEV3qaA.text: I'd been here a number of years back, and I'm glad I came back!  Good food, great beer selection, and outstanding service (even on a busy night.)  We only went for a snack and a few beers, but I'll be going back and augmenting this review as needed!

58I1QVpIB24VJF4SwAEwXQ.text: Love the selection and chocolate stout! Great service and knowledgeable staff. Went on a Tuesday had half off lunch.

Rpn3o8SOuKURYjPSP7kjPg.text: Great beer selection, great atmosphere, great bartenders. What more can I say? Perfect for someone wanting to enjoy a beer with good friends. Monday night is the night for great specials but I prefer to go the other nights of the week when The Saucer is a bit quieter. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who is has nothing good to say about Charlotte night life, this will certainly change your mind. Give the fresh pretzels with queso a try!

0VAAYHY5vxnPb5j9pDIdMA.text: Not really even sure how you can bad mouth the place....its beer heaven

N-uj84HKquzVmiu5DtghRA.text: It's fairly obvious when you see an endless line of platters on the wall highlighting those who have had 200 or more different beers... the place is popular and its regulars are very much so.  This place is about beer, pure and simple.  The food is but an accessory.  They did have a nice pretzel side with some mustard that will clean your sinuses... I recommend that dish between beers 2 and 3, just to keep your beer to food ratio in balance.

PMtlNMDc9qSg6X96KU9E-Q.text: Incredible atmosphere and impeccable staff. Everything from the beer choices, mouthwatering meal options and the modern, relaxing atmosphere culminates in a perfect date night or a nice hang out for you and your friends.

E6vyPU4SlwaKNqSbZ0cnbg.text: Best beer selection, staff, and atmosphere in town.  Ignore that other taproom in Charlotte, this is the True home for beer fans!

frXx4NUx9HAZwBCTrNFzcg.text: The flying saucer is great!  They have over 70 beers on tap that change frequently.  On top of the awesome beer selection they have a fun beer club that only costs 15 bucks.  You get a card to swipe and it keeps track of which beers you have tried and which beers you have left. The food is also pretty good.  They have a few german dishes that pair well with the beer options and also a few other typical bar food items.  The drink specials are enough to keep you coming back as well...along with the activities on different nights (trivia tuesday night, and glass night on Wednesdays).  If you like beer and a fun atmosphere then check out the flying saucer and join the UFO club.

lGI9dM4MkSbmpVZ_E4iHRw.text: Obviously a great beer selection but I also have no problem with the food. After eating at a TGI Fridays or the like I feel like I've done irreparable harm to my innards, but "the Saucer" offers veggie sandwiches, really decent pizzas, salads on top of the regular bar cuisine. My coworkers and I head out there every Tuesday for half-priced lunches and we're usually back on Friday nights to kick off the weekend. The saucer raises the bar on the "cute girls and beer" business model and usually attracts a very outgoing / easy-to-socialize with crowd.

s7dk3apB18NDVvp5pJX4MQ.text: First night in Charlotte and just wanted some bar food, nothing fancy. Thought it would be dead on a Monday night, didn't know they offer $3 draft beers on Monday night!  Service was great, Emily stopped by the table consistently to see if anything was needed.  When you ordered a beer despite how busy it was, it was on the table in a minute or two.  Had the Sheboygan Side-by-Side with fries instead of potato salad.  The fries were a little cold, but Emily quickly addressed the situation by bringing out hot fries making this a five star review.  If you like a a variety of beers, good brat's, and great service come to the Flying Saucer.

X1RXDyar-uHgmrLnn1mzcA.text: This place is great if you are looking for a big variety of beer, although I have heard Taco Mac has more (have yet to go there).  This is a good locals spot for UNCC students, workers in the area and folks that live nearby (you get some walkers like myself).  The beer can be a bit pricey if you plan on having more than a couple (beers average about $4.00-$5.00 a pint) unless you go on a Monday, in which they have "Damn Near All" for $3.00 a pint.  The girls dress nice (for a guy like myself - Hey! I enjoy the atmosphere).  They usually wear some type of kilted dress and that gives the place some bonus points in my opinion.  The food here is pretty stellar too for a bar joint.  Bratwurst, pretzels and the spinach/artichoke dip is pretty of the chain here.  Overall, a good experience except for the pricing.  Beers are a bit steep but that's what you pay for when you want craft beer from across the world/country.  If you are a beer person, step right in.  This is the place to be!

gPcLMaoMri4apoCMZD2pEQ.text: Five stars for being exactly what it sets out to be: a beer lover's ultimate experience! I am now on a quest to drink 200 different beers from all around the world to get my name on a platter. The burger was good, but it came all-the-way (without mentioning that it would). So if you do not want mayo, mustard, pickles, lettuce, tomato and onion you need to tell them when you order. My friend ate a wrap and loved it, but the beer is the reason to visit.

kSA-qFN6EPpRRMSP022cRQ.text: As a place to try a new brew, the Flying Saucer is probably as good as you're going to get in most towns. But, if you're fortunate to live near a decent local brewery or brewpub, you'd be better off sampling their fare than wading into this Applebees of a bar. Great beer selection; decent service; atmosphere feels like they tried to cram the entire British Isles into a space next to Kinkos.

ke_zsPpqeG0en16S5JLgHQ.text: If you're looking for sold out beer look no further! This place has every sour (sold out) and tons of IPAs! (Popular ones sold out). At least the Guinness is still running

We2o12ZBJoG0rR1s0CPw_Q.text: This is a pretty cool place, came here to watch the game. My boyfriend and his roommate are in the UFO club so they come here pretty often, from what I understand it's a pretty cool deal if you are local. There's a  $18 membership. After you try out about 200 varieties of beer you get a shirt, name of a plate with they will hang on the wall (or ceiling), free brunch every Sunday, discounted beers and a $100 bar credit.  The beer gets a little pricey, but it's not ridiculous. Yesterday we ordered the chicken strips and pretzels. The chicken strips and fries were good with ranch and ketchup sauces included. The pretzels were huge! The queso that came with them was not as impressive. Felt like theater style nacho cheese and not spicy at all.   Will be back... Maybe even join the UFO club when I'm local.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. Two giant soft pretzels with double queso!
Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. IPA in a can?!
Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beer tasting flight

8YG6KhBIWiFE2KGhEHvK-Q.text: I love this place. There are always new beers cycling in and they have the largest selection around. The staff is extremely knowledgeable, friendly, and helpful.  I suggest becoming a member of the UFO club.  It is only about $25 and some useful perks you receive are a t-shirt when you sign up, free beer on your birthday, updates on new beers and events (via e-mail), and although I haven't been recently, the free brunch on Sundays is my favorite part of the UFO club. Who doesn't love free food?

CY3YLDg938KIrqI8J0OwgA.text: Truly a hidden GEM in the university area. Had no idea this place existed until about a week ago. Tons of different craft beers and good food to go along with them. Can't wait to go back and try more. Who knows, I may just become a regular.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States

650XOIH_cwfxzoLh5dTyAg.text: This Flying Saucer was a bit different than the one in Raleigh, to my surprise. The set up is mostly the same, maybe a bit smaller than Raleigh, but I was expecting the same menu.  They did not have my go-to, the "Kick Ass Chicken Sandwich" on the menu (so good!).. They did have burgers though which is something Raleigh does not have. Most of them sounded pretty good too. I ended up ordering the Saucer Dipster with fries & ranch for dipping. The sandwich was great! A heavy portion of tasty roast beef and the horseradish mayo was a nice touch. Perfect with the Au Jus! The fries left a bit to be desired though and the ranch was basically Hidden Valley, store bought.   I also ordered a local North Carolina flight of beers which was a cool menu option. Our waitress was great. She was really sweet and made sure we always had what we needed. I think they were having issues with the music though. It was really loud and scratchy sounding at times. I'm not talking like old people don't like "loud" restaurants either.. It was uncomfortably loud.  Just a quick tip.. I did not order them this time, but if the pretzels are the same as in Raleigh.. They are life changing with the queso and mustard! The mustard is spicy and a game changer.

7B9T7b3GZY59QQeVqC56uA.text: Beer selection...5 stars.   The selection is extensive and broad.   Foreign,  domestic,  craft galore. Also have flights available for sampling.   My wife loves the Catawba Peanut Butter Jelly Time and was happy to see it offered.   Food...4 stars. Pizza with balsamic vinegar and prosciutto was excellent.   I enjoyed the bratwurst as well.     Service...4 stars.   Very busy place,  yet always seemed to have our server around when we wanted her. Food was slow coming out, even for being that busy.   That is why I'm not giving 5 stars for service.   Value...5 stars.  Great portion sizes and food and drink both reasonably priced.   Ambience...3 stars.   Loud!  Everyone seemed to feel the need to be heard in their groups by getting above the white noise.   I sat across from my wife and could hear her fine without her screaming,  but then again,  we hadn't knocked back five beers either.   It's not a romantic spot,  it's a place to drink beer.  All in all, this was a very good visit,  and we would return, although we might choose to sit outside if the weather permits.

m5tZAyJznyXvgi5xLS2MYA.text: Brittany (spelling?) was an excellent bar tender. She made great recommendations!  I recommend that you try this place!  I had the Cigar City White Oak Jai Alai (since I'm a Florida boy), the Heavy Seas Tropicannon (her recommendation) and some food.  I'll definitely come back when I'm in town

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. Love, love, love Cigar City and Heavy Seas
Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States

xm9HcECwQUCdbjexXuoyIQ.text: This place was slammed prior to the concert and it quick service. I'm talking standing room only and a wait for tables. Didn't take long for us a sit down though which was nice. Had drinks delivered within 7 minutes of sitting down. Fantastic service. Good food. Had the Cobb salad and dad had the Italian Eatery sandwich. Good food. Good beer. Good cider. Definite come again. Definitely stop if you need a place for food or drinks. Nice decor. Good environment. ZERO complaints.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States

HDnR8ULczV5wpql-b7ZDuA.text: As someone raised PA Dutch, this place hits the spot.  They should throw anyone that orders a burger right out the door!  Don't get me wrong, my son erroneously ordered a burger and it was great.  But why in the world would you come here and not get great examples of German food?!  In my best Arnold impression "Ahhl be back!"

8Q13XHfAiweNuIGAIyLqVQ.text: There are a lot of things to like about the Flying Saucer.  Once you join the UFO club ($18) you get a beerknurd shirt and can enjoy free brunch every Sunday.  The brunch isn't anything to write home about but they also offer North Carolina draft beers for $3.50 on Sundays as well. You can't really beat brunch and a couple of local beers for under $10.   Other things I like about the Saucer: Plenty of parking Great service Nice staff Kids are welcome  Certainly worth a trip if you're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nice beer selection!

eaPsVKwZi5QH6G-9i1M4mA.text: Food was ok, but one of our items took over an hour,  even though it was the first thing we ordered.  They said they would send it to go, we were headed to a concert.  Over 30 minutes later,  still no food. One of our guests had to run in after our server to get our check,  after we asked for it twice.  Line cook screamed at her and server when they asked for togo food.  If I could add a photo to the trash we received,  I would.  Wasn't expecting much and was disappointed

CYtiRRo-KP0ibf1vxIAAyA.text: There are so few places where atmosphere and quality food meet but Flaying Saucer is one of them! Best pretzels and queso that I have ever had, and I just got back from Germany so that is saying something! Buffalo wings do not disappoint and the pizza is very good as well! Beer list is extremely extensive and for those who don't drink beer they have a lot of other choices! I will definitely return on my next trip to Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pretzels with queso and hot wings

2trnorQSeuC_yfO5pmnOXA.text: I have only gotten take out here but the portions were big & food was all great! I especially recommend the fried zucchini appetizer, which was much larger than I would have guessed. It also wasn't too greasy like most fried things.  The hummus & pita was also good.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried zucchini app...HUGE &amp; delicious!

9Tv0H5lCNBiWPOvsKwz1IA.text: Just average.  The atmosphere is bar-like, which I guess they want.  They have many beer selections.  The soft pretzels are pretty good.  I would definitely go back for a casual night out. The service has always been decent.  Nothing special or different about it.

nhC0LtRKErPFV5NxEu2zcA.text: Happy New Year, my only regret is missing the other beers in the "Demons of Ale" series at the @flyingsaucercharlotte because this is the first beer I have had from @averybrewingco and it is the best beer I have ever had. I am turning 31 soon and I've just had the best beer I have ever had and I can only imagine how good the other beers in "The Demons of Ale" series must have been. I'd also like to thank @flyingsaucerraleigh for being my first Flying Saucer experience and where I got my Beer Nurd card! Happy New Year everyone, today was the best day of 2016, ending on a high note at the #flyingsaucer !

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States

3FpK2kn3gNgHQVQBEHG6eg.text: Dan would like to offer up a 4-star. The beer selection was good, a mix between recognizable and regional brews.   Lots of tv's for game nights.   I only went with the grilled cheese and tomato soup (it was a chilly night and a long work day) and Dan had the chicken sandwich. Both were good and plenty hearty.  We are at the bar and our server was helpful and happy. We stopped by after 9pm on a Saturday night. It wasn't hard to get seats.  We'll be back again before the end of this business trip.

smD4kKctEJXxTvA7EBTi5A.text: We enjoyed the beer selection and the food.  It was a busy night so the food took a little bit longer than I think is normal. The wait staff was in a hurry I guess and 2 different staffers manager to drop something on me (dirty silverware). I would go back.   Great location for pre-post concerts at pnc pavilion.

ZeDIIdY-wVMg5fBeKzcmFQ.text: The wife and I wanted to just hang out watch some of the games. So we decided to check them out. My coworkers came here once so I wanted to try them. It wasn't to shabby.   They have a great selection of beers on tap and bottles. On game day they have beer specials. They have  plates all over the wall. If you join and drink so many beers you get you name on a plate and it placed on the wall.  The food was pretty good. We just had wings and fries but still pretty good. Our server was friendly and I look forward to hanging out there again.

l1f-DZEAnzEbHocjFiARMg.text: GREAT selection of beers, both local and from all over the country. Had a burger with side salad. Good bar food. I'd recommend just based on beer selection.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States

ewOVthiHB_O3T89B9mgn8g.text: After coming here enough times to achieve Dukedom, I can confidently say this place is spot on with their beer selection. The waitresses are very knowledgeable with the different styles of brew, and are more than happy to give you a sample pouring if you ask them. The food is good. There's some solid appetizer options like the large pretzels or the bacon wrapped jalapenos; it is a little pricey though. For the most part, the service is great, but I've had a few hiccups. This isn't anything extremely note worthy though. They have made a loyal      guest out of me.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. Some of there most reason beer releases

ijMlo-pgAUNQqdTR-cJHUw.text: Very poor experience.  Lack of professionalism with the management staff.  The manager called a guest in our party an a..hole.  Very poor professionals, manager assumed and failed to follow through nor did the wait staff ID anyone.  We will not visit this location again.

8Dlm2ydmwR8NPMLP7i-wFA.text: Great selection of beer, if that's all your here for sit at the bar.  Poor service and low quality food.  I really wanted it to be better.

KHpRKV7S2Lg52wgB83VQZw.text: For a bar, it's a fun place.  As far as an eatery, I definitely don't recommend their shepherd's pie.  Portion was small, the seasoning just wasn't there.  Atmosphere wise, like I said, it makes a great social place.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States

_2tWaOtUI8JRCTQInu8tdg.text: I am obsessed with the hippie burger here. It is just so amazing!!   I have had the pretzels and they are just as good. The staff is a little slow but usually when I go it has been busy so it is understandable.   Great beer choices

zIS-7iEAmkfsSCWGtxeihw.text: Great place to go if you like beer. The food is really good too especially the stuffed jalapenos. The waitress was extremely nice and offered free tasting of any of the beers we were interested in.

wyLuraZWPlJXATqGZhM1-w.text: Arrived at 7pm on a Thursday night. Left after 20 minutes of watching several servers pass our table of three without acknowledging our existence. We sat inside across from bar at a booth and the place was about 80%full. Disappointing experience.

rryyPKYoMQqmc7qqwTQqhA.text: Fabulous!  Tried a mess of beers here today and had a great time.  Our server (they're all pretty cute and young and wearing plaid pleated miniskirts for you boys out there to get loaded and tip well) was extremely helpful with me insofar as picking out my "build your own flight" of beer.  They have a few pre-set flights, which my folks tried...  but I tried the build your own, which is basically five draught beers of your choice in a smaller size glass (photo enclosed).  It was a great way to try new things and once our server learned my taste she worked with me to find what I would like best.    Between that, the friendly crowd, darts and pool... if I lived in NC I could see wasting a lot of time here.  Didn't try the food so I can't comment on that.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beer Sampler

kbPSNXXDSR82vp8lMWpRlg.text: Not bad for a few drinks and some OK food. Service wasnt bad though. 3 stars just because the burger I had was average.

LN-QD3d6u9rN98VFH3pifQ.text: The Mojo wings are the best I've ever had...ever. And the fantastic selection of beers isn't so bad either!

CJkZPL6dG95aP4ZDJzXiUQ.text: I was all ready to give this place a good review. Stopped there Friday night, had a good dinner and a couple of stouts.  Came back Sunday night after the NASCAR race in Martinsville to watch the world series game 4, mets and royals.  You know by now that Jeff Gordon wins the NASCAR race and the royals win the world series.  Here's the rub: the door  clearly states the hours on Sunday - 12pm to 2 a.m.  I checked on the way in. I wanted to watch the world series if it was on or I would've gone elsewhere.  The Royals had a big top of the 12 inning running up 5 runs to make it 2-7 Royals.  When I turned back to the game from talking to the guy next to me the giant screen was black and they are closed, "no were not turning it back on".  Jerks.  It's the world series for Christ's sakes.  I go outside to my car and by the time I figure out how to find the game in my phone the score is 2-7 final.  They could have waited 5 minutes since the Mets rolled over in the bottom of the 12. Thanks I would have liked to see it.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hours are 12 ta 2 A.freaking M. Sunday. Not midnight! Ass wipe
Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. 88 taps

RTngyKtwrgQUnzRJH8nv-g.text: My boyfriend and I stopped by to kill some time when we were driving from DE to SC. The draft list was impressive - I was very much a fan. Great place to grab a quick drink if you want to try something different!

C6GqQF6-UyK0rru05Qn7bg.text: The food is alright at best, very blah. I guess it's there for when you've drank too many beers. Great selection and menu though. Wouldn't be my first choice as a place for dinner, but maybe after dinner drinks. The service was OK, felt a little rushed even when the place wasn't too busy.

3U8VydlqIfXsGr5YkNkewQ.text: Beer Enthusiasts Rejoice!  Lots of beer options to choose from here from draft to bottle.  Definitely agree with Ian that the location should be closer to Uptown, but it is near my office which provides a good after work "cool down".  I do have a running crew that runs on certain afternoons and we totally replace the lbs of sweat lost with beer weight.  It's a good time though and their menu is pretty diverse.  I usually go for the hippie or turkey burger with potato salad.  I am still working towards my name being emblazoned on the wall... (75 beers in).  I like the fact that I started my UFO club membership in Raleigh and will probably finish it here in Charlotte.

0D-JFOligbYaiUjove_5CQ.text: The first couple times I came here, I had no idea it was a chain. Then one day I was passing through Raleigh and there was another one. Chain or not, The Flying Saucer is a fine establishment for beer drinkers. With a beer selection that appears to approach national debt numbers, it's pretty tough to not find a beer you are interested in. The food is so-so but really, who cares. Knock back a few of your favorites and that soft pretzel with cheese and mustard to dip it in tastes like a gourmet feast. Just for kicks, join the UFO club and after you consume enough beers, you get a personalized plate on the wall or ceiling or wherever there's room these days.   My one complaint?  Too far from home.

yvwHEAo1Dsgtz3XEqBnNNw.text: I love the taste of beer, and this place has wonderful selections!!! Don't forget to wash that tasty beverage down with some bratwursts and pretzels!!!

KhaLki-8CIDwIaBEi4RRPw.text: Poor service.   Waitress refused to serve us because she misread my friend's license and said it was expired.   It doesn't expire for two years...   we were kicked out.   I realize this location is next to a college and they must be on the alert for shenanigans but being denied service when you are  28 and have a valid license is very frustrating.

KOvRlG7xDndgxTCwUFcSww.text: The Flying Saucer was awesome!  Great decor, even better menu and fantastic beer!  We LOVED the pretzels, the Arugula and Porchuttio pizza, and the Spicy beer cheese soup was DELICIOUS!  Our order came out a little slow, but we didn't even hardly notice, but the manager took our beers off the bill!  We are hoping a location will open up in Greensboro!

XEUmVp1SiZu6As-BVjO3nA.text: This place is delicious, excellent beers and great food. The only thing I don't like here is the waiters are always changing and most of them can't do their job properly because they are either new or maybe it's because they don't write down their orders. Service is awful here. But it's still the best burger in town.

f71r2ELl5Og3TJDTZw5trw.text: I am only giving this place 3 stars based on their beer selection and my companion's lunch quality.  When we stopped in with the kids it was a really nice big restaurant.  They have a sitting area and great big bar.    Very fun atmosphere with all the plates on the ceiling of the adventuresome drinkers.  Service was great and fast.  I had the Saucer Dipster sandwich - man what  a let down.  It was supposed to be like a French Dip I think.  It was just two pieces of roast beef on a huge hard roll with one piece of cheese.  What a let down.  And i paid $8.49?!?!?!    Everyone else liked their sandwiches tho so we will probably be back except I for sure wont get that again.

AyAw2qednwA_1TAvm1XLhA.text: The flying saucer has a great atmosphere. Hard wood, and nice decor render a great pub feel. The flying saucer offers a nice draft selection as well.   However, the wait staff and food is below average. An exception is made for the pretzel, but the cheese served with the pretzel was stale. The saucer pies (12 inch pizza) is among the worst I've had in Charlotte. The sauce had a bitter taste, and the ingredients used didn't taste fresh.   Our service was slow. Definitely could have been an off night for the wait staff. I'm skeptical though. I gave our waitress the benefit of the doubt until I repeatedly spotted her behind the bar chatting with co workers. Meanwhile she neglected refills, messed up food orders, and forgot drink orders.   If you are only interested in grabbing a few beers at a pub, then the flying saucer is the right spot. If you are looking for dinner and drinks, then you're better off spending your money elsewhere.

uQ5psclgYKMG-3lowJd7bg.text: This Flying Saucer location is in the perfect spot for UNCC students to hit up. The Flying Saucer is a chain of specialty beer pubs that have all types of beer on draft. The staff at each of the locations are very knowledgeable in all kinds of beer so it is the perfect place to be adventurous and try something new. If you are a beer lover I would recommend joining the UFO club since you get a gift for completing the 200 beer tasting challenge. They also have yummy bar food such as pretzels, burgers, ect. if you want somethin nice to eat along with your beer. Overall it is a great place to grab a drink!

wR5w4Gxmss6eR_hB5mrcSg.text: As a craft enthusiast and recent CA transplant, I will advise anyone with an expectation of service to avoid this place. Was intending to dine here, but after no follow-up visit from our waitress, we left.   I'm guessing regulars get better treatment

EDT7s9HnGi17FBoFPkB9cg.text: We were looking for a place to grab a late lunch after an event on campus and the students with us suggested this spot. When we arrived it was almost empty and we sat ourselves at a booth inside.   We started with the fried zucchini appetizer which was good and not overly fried or greasy. I then had a salad and the tomato soup, both of which were good, but nothing to write home about.   The beer selection here looked good, and I loved the neighborhood feel of the place. They've got a beer club, where you can join and once you've had 250 beers you get a plate on the wall - which makes the wall full of quirky quotes and personalities of the many folks who've achieved this honor and is of course a great ploy to get folks to keep coming back.   Overall the food is average, but seems like a great spot for beers and I'd imagine the vibe and crowd is good on the weekends/evenings.

E3We6f2mszCynIBRLNYGpg.text: Very unusual Gastropub  I'm running behind and actually thought I had already posted this review but apparently I did not. Back in May, two of my friends from Ohio went to the 300 race at Charlotte Motor Speedway and had dinner here afterwards.  It's a nice place with good service and a somewhat whimsical menu.  Main selling point is their Saucer Club where you consume 200 different beers or ales and you get a Saucer with your name on it mounted on the walls or ceiling.  Considering the number of different bottled beers and ales and the broad selection on tap which changes weekly, not hard to have two hundred different one.  Food is a bit of an afterthough but what they do have is very good. I have the Reuben-esque, while my friends had a Saucer Dipster and the Chicken Sandwich. The Chicken Sandwich sound plain but with the bacon, guacamole, pepper jack cheese, etc, is anything but  Room is like an old pub with the exception of the several hundred Saucers on the Walls and Ceiling from those who have come before and have been sucessful

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. A small representation of the Saucers commemorating those who have rose to the challenge
Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States

0VLNYR8N-RdZDuk1ywpnZQ.text: Very friendly and attentive bartenders, interesting and unique decor.   Awesome beer selection and I had a decent burger!   Pretty damn good

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. beeeeeer

-m4yBsAsHyaEHuc_wcYT0Q.text: Beer lover? This is the place for you!! 100 beers on tap & if you join the club and drink enough beers...you get your own plate on the wall. Get an appetizer of a giant pretzel with cream cheese dip! You won't be sorry

X3jw8xvmCsIHOHfTeAlGvA.text: I have given this establishment several chances because it is popular among friends and colleagues but have consistently been disappointed with the service and quality of food.   For starters, this is just not a place for people of color to hang out. The staff seem hesitant to be helpful/accommodating and the only difference I can generally distinguish between myself and other patrons is the color of my skin. I hope this is not a universal experience for people of color, nonetheless, it quickly became apparent that my white counterparts were receiving a much higher quality service experience than myself.   Additionally, the quality of food and delivery time is just abysmal. On multiple occasions, I was served cold, not warm, but COLD food after a significant wait and requested a replacement, only to have a plate returned to my table with soggy and lukewarm food.   The one star I've provided is for the extensive beer list. Nonetheless, even the beer I was served appeared to be from the bottom of the barrel...

5-i9ALpg5iDksBr_X4H_jQ.text: Went here last Sunday. The place seems pretty nice and have a good collection of beer. Unfortunately, their beers are insanely expensive. The cheapest beer is $5 and there aren't many $5 options. The average price for their beers is $6-$7. A little steep IMO. They do have $3.50 domestic beers on Sundays and I *think* all beers are $3.50 on Mondays but I could be wrong about the latter. We ordered the pretzel-bratwurst board to share. That was more than enough food and good bang for your buck at $15. You get two pretzels, two brats, sauerkraut and bread with queso and mustard dips. They do allow dogs out on the patio, and the patio is really nice, as long as you aren't sitting right next to a party of 8 in their mid-fifties, totally drunk and openly flirting and getting touchy-feely with the servers. Not sure how they tolerate this behavior? Must be regulars, I guess. We will probably be back, but this might not be our go-to spot for beers and hangouts. Not at $6 beers... Ain't nobody got money for that.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. The pretzel bratwurst platter. Yum!

c3Y8_7MwE-pe0wP5YwG_dw.text: Solid choices of beer... probably one of the best in the Charlotte area.  Food was excellent, although just your basic pub type stuff.  Will definitely visit again when I'm down by UNCC

oUz51hBVjxLdQgMCeLVVHQ.text: Stopped through here on business, looking for local beers and a decent burger on a Sunday.  I immediately like the expansive space, very roomy and open, almost like a beer hall.  The bar was the place to be, apparently.  I waited for a while to get a seat at the bar so I wouldn't take up a table by myself (I hate when people do that).  Despite the completely full bar, the staff was on point.  I was quickly brought a food and beer menu, made aware of the specials going on, and was pleasantly left alone to go over the menu.  The bartender was really good at reading her customers, knowing when they needed something without asking and making everyone feel welcome.  The food was good, although the beer selection was much more impressive.  Between the value, customer service and liquid product, I would definitely make this a stopping point in the area.

LTXb-TPmF64pZn1Pzd6kqw.text: We really like this place the ambience is great the lighting is wonderful which I can't say in most places anymore staff is very friendly and knowledgeable about the beer. Play really enjoyed the German food there one potato salad is truly delicious I just to the for the vinegar tang to make it interesting their spicy mustard is to die for really packs a punch without overdoing it. I am joyed the tomato soup Odell I got quite a few bits of those little rolled up tomato skins which was a little offputting but the flavor was quite good nice consistency the right balance of richness and tanginess The house green salad is a beautiful mix of really lovely cream is not just crunchy Romain or iceberg I'm not too much baby greens but really nice green leaf lettuce my complaint and it's kind of a big one the blue cheese dressing has a weird chemical taste and is quite off putting sort of meat you got hungry for the rest of my food.  It's too bad they don't make their own it's a very simple it makes such a difference plus cheaper to make them buy

D9IwB119aJQuqwkaVSs7Sw.text: Large beer selection, food limited but everything we ordered was good. Giant pretzels were really good. Bacon wrapper stuffed jalapeno was the bomb. Dry rub wings could have used more seasoning but were really good. Server(Tia) was friendly and smiled and was attentive to our needs, really good server. She was knowledgeable about menu and different beers.

PKBf9gxZwSZm24DiT7tCOA.text: This is the best place to grab a drink! Great specials and great service! I can always count on this place for great beer and food!!!

diTGx5MFL-otXJMA-rnyiQ.text: Beer lovers must love this spot!  Tons of draft options, lot of local and fall seasonal beers with four not scary ghost beers to try.  Fun spot, out side area for dogs with their little personal water dish.  Food is delicious and bread is amazing.  Had a german dish that had not overly spiced mustard to compliment the sauerkraut with perfectly charred sausage with a side of authentic warm German potato salad..... best meal in town, with beers and lots of television for game day.  Love it!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. German dish, best part is hidden under sauerkraut.

QIwuiuQLIAguByl1CBEvMA.text: This place screams college in the best way.  You might run into your old TA, a girl from class, or even your professor. Fun, good beer, and friendly staff make this place a good spot to chill and knock a few back.

k20Kphc-PKXpxuIapqFjfA.text: The Saucer is the best place to go near UNCC.  The food is always fantastic, the staff is amazing, and the beer selection is unrivaled. I've been to the Saucer easily over 100 times and haven't had a bad experience even once.

qRnMmxK_B8HflnG0f8Wb2g.text: We visited here after it was given rave reviews by some of my friends who went to UNCC. We sat on the patio as the bar was absolutely packed for a Saturday night. They were doing trivia at the time and so that was fun. If you are looking for mixed drinks, this is not the place for you. However, there is a vast variety of draft beers. I was excited to see that that they have a dog friendly patio and will even offer your pooch some refreshing water as well! There were no food specials which was disappointing especially on a trivia night.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States

_vblWIhpU3AMuS6aU4HvEw.text: Flying saucer has an amazing collection of beer and a wonderful ambience and top of it.. interesting and delicious food. It is THE place to hangout with your friends.. loved it the yesterday evening with my friends. The trophy shields all over the place is just wow!. Highly recommended if you are in that area!

klAr5GW_U_ZUYaY9T0GBMQ.text: I'm so upset it's literally a snow day and me and my best friend just wanted to go to a bar and get some drinks so we could relax and chill but they totally gypped us and watered our drinks down and I actually could not taste any of the alcohol in our drinks and we are super upset and annoyed because we already asked him to come and get us a double shot and they brought the double shot back in it he said more water down so I don't know what is going on with this place but definitely do not order mixed drinks here come for the beer because that's all that they have.

8Kb04m_FeCXheARVxzHsdg.text: There is no kids menu because "this is a bar" well then why do you promote your food so hard?!!! And I'm sorry, but if it's during the day/afternoon and I bring my kid here for dinner, I have to buy her an $11 meal?!!!!! The ale house has kids eat for $.99 on Tuesday's and they have 72 drafts and 99 bottles. I will NEVER come here for food ever again (this was also concluded after I ordered guacamole and it's mashed up avocado baby food) and their only sides are fries, potato salad and side salad. A little wack for an $11 meal. THANKS BUT ILL PASS. SAVE YOURSELF

vy3_0kCa1pebqJfwBnBoVA.text: The beer selection is fabulous here, but you probably knew this.  During my last visit I had the Saucer Braztel, Rocket Tots and Garlic Chicken pizza.  I enjoyed those almost as much as the beer.  I only wish I lived closer so I could visit more often...

DpTy5HS9mwmlblbRxkjkSw.text: Wanna get a quick three in ya?  (That's code among my friends for wanna go to the saucer and add three beers to your tour.)  I have yet to get a plate on the wall (requires that you drink 200 different beers) but one day I will be immortalized among my fellow beer lovers.  The saucer is a special place that is hard to fully appreciate by those who do not share a passion for enjoying beer other than bud light, however it is a great place for people who are willing to try something new and expand their beer horizons.  Be cautious when experimenting because they do carry some very expensive brews.  The service is ussually great and one of the most difficult things to do is to avoid the cook-out drive thru after a fun night of some tasty bevs, but just remember friends dont let friends fly drunk.

G7fXj6ekAdVSTY_FIoCFbg.text: I would give this place about 3.5 overall. I have been going there for 7 years, so this is not some uneducated review... This place is aimed more at rich college students than beer aficionados. Some pluses and minuses: Food price and taste-4.5 Most everything I have had there is good and reasonable price. Beer quality and selection-4.6 Samples are available, huge amount of selection, beers served in appropriate glasses, don't think if I have ever gotten a "funky" beer (some places don't clean their draft systems), and fairly knowledgable on the beers. Beer prices-2.5 This is where the "rich college kids" comment comes in to play. They have specials, especially NC beer Sunday and pint nite Monday, which is about the only times I go. But the normal prices for most beers are .50 to $1.50 too much. Wine-2.0 I know it's a beer place, but sometimes people in your party don't like beer. The wine is overpriced, mediocre at best, and often has been open for days. Service- 4.0Most the staff are cute and helpful but there is the occasional terrible service night. Atmosphere- 3 Gets very loud at nights! Combine walls covered in plates with the customers and music volume knob constantly trying to overcome each other, and your throat will be sore the next day. No seriously! Drunk frat boys, noise, and on hot summer days it is 90 plus inside. Sunday afternoons and early evenings are best times to go to actually "hear" yourself taste the beer... The dark wood walls would be nice if it were not for the tacky plates. In summary, if you want to enjoy a good meal and a good beer plan to do it earlier in the day.

CbQWa08Kx4le94xFUnKvgw.text: As a bar this place is fantastic. As a bar and restaurant it needs improvement.  Any place that has a wall full of beer taps is awesome and when it has a great selection and great service - it becomes my favorite. We had a trainee as our waitress (Leslie, I think her name was). She was great - I was surprised at how attentive the wait staff was considering the place was full. The girl who was training Leslie was equally attentive and pleasant. Hopefully the level of service is a norm and not a fluke.   The beer selection is great, although I would love to see more asian beers and couple German/Austrain ones like Lowenbrau, Hofbrau and Steigl on the list.  The place has a cool decor and comfy booths to sit in. It also has outdoor seating if you're one of those who likes to bake while they drink.  The food needs to get better but I will say that it is an innovative menu for a bar and their pretzels were awesome. I also had their beer soup in a bread bowl and that was great as well. The bread itself isn't spectacular but the soup was very tasty.  And on Wednesdays they do a keep the glass thing, where you can get the beer they have for that day with its own glass and keep the glass.   All in all, a good place to go for great beers served by efficient waitresses.

f84JhkDmHqtPiB12ExpZ6g.text: After being prodded and pocked by my co-workers to get a kitchen pass, I finally went to the Flying Saucer. I get the concept.  I appreciate the effort but come on.... shouldn't you look good in a skimpy outfit if you are going to wear one?  I did not really expect great service and that was pretty clear.  Friendly enough but the overall IQ was rather low. I do give a huge nod to the beer selection and for that one reason I am likely to go back.

UurEZ7KT5rXvDpKadmPlNQ.text: Food: 2 Beer: 5 + Atmosphere: 4 Service: 5 Culture: 5 Distance from my apartment for a great drinkery: -1000  4.5 stars  The bar runs almost the entire length of this rather large restaurant.  And taps are placed every foot or so along the entire stretch.   Intrigued?  If not, don't attend.  One thing keeps the Saucer from being tops in Charlotte: the menu.  After having eaten here 3-4 times, the only edible I'd return for is the soft pretzels, (which are orgasmic after a couple brews.)  They offer stereotypical beer accoutrement like sausage and cheese.  But the fried foods lack in number for a bar-eatery.  And damn it, if I'm drinking beer I want more than one or two burgers to choose from.  The wait staff is knowledgeable enough to recommend a malty beverage for the less-than-beer-literate.  And pint-nights offer a bartender selected brew for under $3.  Which means that $3 can buy you anything from a summer swill to a Belgian Framboise brewed by monks in a slate tub, (worth more than $3.)  It's a beer-venture!

RjGV0qMrRLiKkRwzF7GQuw.text: Pretty good food here and the beer selection is of the chain.

VYxhM3rlNHWXsdXFUQxBJQ.text: Great place to hangout for a while and catch a game. I always sit at the bar. Lots and lots of beer to choose from and if you have any questions about any of the beer someone will always be there to help you out. Very friendly staff and service is awesome. Food is great! Tasty and not greasy which is a nice change from typical bar food. This place has definitely opened the "beer door" for me. I've been trying lots of different beers that I don't think i would ever have done if not for discovering this place!

7qIN19aSSLUwYE5QDsdgUQ.text: I. Love. Flying. Saucer. By far my favorite place in Charlotte to grab a beer. It's even better now that smoking is longer allowed inside.

S7VMACijRMLgUie2Dh99uw.text: best beer selection in Charlotte. Great staff and on Wednesdays you get to keep the pint glass.
