556a8SYsKAcanQKfPeTBDg.text: Around 10 of my friends already have their honorary plates on the ceiling, so I go there a lot for their unveiling parties.  It's a nice open environment and they have a great selection of brews.  The giant pretzel is the way to go.  So fluffy and lovely :)

Uetht5ojPCITygIgyxhC0Q.text: Love this place!  Just moved here and am a True beer lover, and this place is like heaven!  Sign up for their UFO club and not only get a tshirt and their incentives, but a great, free Sunday brunch EVERY Sunday.  Cannot recommend highly enough.

bWoHeF_EbuDlkCsUu7OCww.text: I always come here after playing a round of Par 3 golf next door.  How can you go wrong with hundreds of beers, pretty girls and descent bar food?  You can't!  Cool spot - check it out!

xni0798TFHJZ1u2aRkZaQg.text: Beer aficionados rejoice!  If you're like me, you're sick and tired of going out for dinner and having 3-5 draft beers to choose from. I'm thrilled if I can pull a beer not slapped with a "Lite" label; or when I ask for a stout the waitress has something other than Guinness to provide. I crave diversity of lagers and ales like a foodie craves weirdly named cheeses. I'm pretty sure, in fact, that the Saucer was created for people exactly like me.  Walking into the door I instantly get the same feeling of the hole-in-the-wall pubs I frequented back in college - just much larger. And cleaner! Almost every surface not walkable in the building is covered in decorative dishes so dense that your grandma's cabinet just shed a tear. It's cluttered but not oppressive, and again, it always feels clean and comfortable. There's a couched section up front for those really lazy days; elevated booths on the wall for small parties; and a lot of tables for any size group you can organize. And then there's the bar...  Bellying up to the bar at the Saucer is easy - it's roughly 50 feet long. From this bastion of beervana, you can see the real reason you came here - the jaw-dropping wall of tap heads and stuffed bottle coolers. It's a selection so big that trying to pick by looking is almost a fool's errand - you could easily down a pint just while trying to weigh the options. Thankfully, they have a well-organized (and four-page dense) beer menu that will help you find just the draft or bottle you're looking for. I want to give some kind of feeling for what you'll find here, but the simple answer is - everything. I've had everything from double IPAs aged in oak barrels to blueberry wheat beer to a savory coffee milk stout. Any style you could ever want, well, it's here. It's impressive. It's a little terrifying. It's very, very delicious. There are $3 fire sale specials every night of the week as well. Saturday's "Beer Poker" is my favorite - a random bottle from their cooler for three bucks. I've scored a few Victory and Rogue bottles there, so it is definitely not just the leftovers.   As for the food, well... It's decent. Let's be fair, I'm not coming here for their burgers. Food at the saucer is a means to an end; the food is here so you can cleanse your pallet between brews. That being said, there are a few musts on the menu. For a snack, you cannot beat the soft pretzels. You get two, they're huge, warm, salty and soft - if you're on a date and you don't get this, don't expect a second date. The brats are decent, the burgers have flavor, and oh yeah - spicy cheesy pepper tater tots. You'll find something.   I guess the last thing worth mentioning is the service. A place with this diverse a beer selection could rest on its laurels, but the Saucer follows through with an excellent staff. Beyond the fact that your waitresses are gorgeous smiling Beer Goddesses wearing short short skirts and knee-hi stockings... They're genuinely nice and know what they've got on the menu. Talking with them is talking with peers. They check in on the table frequently and always have a good recommendation on what beer is next. A few of them pay attention enough to recognize me and remember what I had on the last visit. Coming to the saucer is like hanging out with friends.  One last word of advice - if you're serious about your beer exploration, sign up for the UFO club. For $18 you get a commemorative t-shirt and a membership which clears you from (very infrequent) cover charges and lets you track the beers you have on each visit. Drink 200 different beers and you get your name in the ring of honor, a commemorative plate on the wall, and a $100 tab for a party for you and your friends. There's a reward every 50 - I just earned a free pint - and you get the benefit of trying a ridiculously wide selection of beers and learning more about what the craft has to offer. You will find new favorites and probably a few that you can't stand. But that's the point of the journey, now, isn't it?  So bottoms up, there's a lot to drink. As for me, I'm going to discuss with my Beer Goddess which brew is next on my list!

rAjzoTsezbMvqmeJwb2Gvw.text: Well, I don't drink beer.  So that's not a draw for me.  But I do eat food and I have friends who drink beer.  So I came here for dinner and comradery and was pleasantly not severely disappointed.  Most bar food is wretched and disgusting with little selection and bad service.  But here the food was almost decent in quality and quite tasty with a wide selection and above mediocre service.  It's actually OK.  I wouldn't come here just for dinner, and it's terribly noisy so that having a conversation is basically impossible, but the patio is almost nice and the people here are friendly.  So I wouldn't refuse to go here again...but I won't recommend it either.

Jsncvr5TRMLwiTpYQnTdlA.text: If you're a fan of great beers, great food and good times then you have to visit Flying Saucer Draught Emporium.  This place has almost every beer under the sun and some of the best bar food that I've ever tasted.  The pretzels are a must have every time I go.  The only downfall is that it's not Uptown so I can't indulge the way I would like to. Cheers!

GWVPDvKL9qS8_Liy8QNHEA.text: So many beer options, decent food, and pint night for $3 on Monday.

3zXpfIaGn4x_EtAaP47oEQ.text: Great place and enough beer there to please anyone. You have to join the beer club and try to drink around the world. I am in the process of this now and I am having a lot of fun doing it! The food is ok but when you do go there you MUST get the pretzels the dipping sauce is great. You can either dip it in Cheese sauce or spicy mustard. I tell you, it is real hot. Go on Football game days they have great drink specials.

DAWK_-IuPojKknWFEqInqw.text: I am really ambiguous about this place. The beer selection rocks; the food sucks rocks. The staff is knowledgeable, friendly (at times TOO much so!) and dressed like Lolita Complexes. Sooo not my thing! I have spent a LOT of time here, but no longer go for personal reasons that are not germaine to this review. How much time, you ask? 8 plates worth! (I was the number 2 8th time around...but I had my plates removed when I ceased to patronize their establishment. See also personal reasons not germaine, yadda yadda yadda) If you truly like beer, this is the place to go. The staff really knows their beer, so ask questions, sample and take direction!!! The pint specials are good, and the "beer poker" is worth it if you are adventurous and like a wide variety of styles of beer. As a suggestion, eat elsewhere first, or shortly after. I mean, how many chicken caesar rollups, wings and salads can you stomach? The one plus to the menu? They often undercook the burgers, which means this little Yankee got rare beef on a regular basis...which I crave but rarely find in NC. They also overcook a lot of other choices... so...it's a mixed bag food-wise. If the atmosphere wasn't so decidedly sex-sells-beer-to-men...I'd like it better. Sorta. maybe. But those personal issues still work there- I mean, exist. Without the emotional baggage, this is worth checking out if you are serious about beer.

lLJBLGj2aYDUmyKX9mFehQ.text: I have just recently started loving beer. It took me a while to gain an appreciation for it, but now that I have I have been looking for places that can offer a unique beer drinking experience.  I have to say that this place definitely gives you that.  It's a real bar with lots of beers to choose from both well known brands, and more obscure ones.  Very friendly place and everyone is more than willing to offer suggestions as to which beers to try.  Plus plenty of deal nights and specials to keep you from going broke.  There are also lots of fun gimmicky deal and theme nights which just makes for a fun time if you want to participate.

uizlO9aARUpG0tZMEr81pA.text: been here a few times over the years, never have had the food, but always enjoyed good conversation over many a good brew.  Selection is pretty vast, they even do an ok job making sure to include the local stuff.  A little pricey, but I think I need to change my perception of fair prices as I have found myself writing that a lot lately, ha.

Fz4yYsN_IkE1bB1uOjzudg.text: Best beer selection in the area. Wait staff is so friendly and knowledgeable.  Heck the waitresses know more about beer than I do! That's saying something. The brat con queso  is a an awesome appetizer.

JBaQVWNUn7WbA1XBGAKFqQ.text: I like the beer selection and love the Colorado beer connection since I have roots from there. However the food side needs a little work. More pizza selections and sizes wouldn't hurt would they? Appetizers aren't bad in general. Overall it's a decent place to go for a chain joint.

pg2xc8vL6rIXVoFpW8lBgg.text: I've been to the Saucer probably 5 or 6 times so far, and it's pretty awesome. I'm not really a beer drinker, but they have a TON. I enjoy their beer poker nights, when you can try a random brew for cheap. The food is good, for a bar.  The jalapeno Rocket Tots are definitely a favorite. The service is usually great, and of course, is easy on the eyes. My only complaint is that it gets REALLY loud in here sometimes, to the point that it's hard to hear any conversation at all.  Not sure how that could be remedied, but there you have it. Give this place a shot if you're looking to try some new brews!

k-dZIr3D6vZDwuv50ESjJA.text: The Saucer is my favorite place to get a beer in Charlotte. I originally tried this place about 7 years ago and couldn't deal with the smoke. I kind of gave up on it after that. However since, they've banned smoking in restaurants a few years ago myself and some guys from work stopped by one night and I've been coming here about once a week since.  The pretzels are awesome, the brats are as well. Beer selection... well if they don't have something you like chances are you just don't like beer. Hell, even then they have a full bar not to mention beer drinks with flavors that most people who "don't like beer" wouldn't imagine to exist in beer. My wife (who isn't a big beer person) loves the hummingbird water which is a pear cider and raspberry lambic that tastes like a liquid jolly rancher.  The girls that work there really know their beer and usually make excellent recommendations. It can be a bit loud if it's busy so sometimes talking can be a challenge. The backroom is usually better in those situations. They've also renovated the back room so, it isn't so hard to get a table these days.

YWHA5kaenhBWzJytQDrP9g.text: The Saucer has a "je ne sais qua" the other bars in University City have yet to acquire. It's much more than the thousand or so saucers on the walls and ceiling and almost as many taps behind the bar, although both are quite impressive. The best description I can pull off that contradicts itself is a classy, yet non-corporate atmosphere, with scantily-clad waitresses that remind you of anything but Hooters. The staff has a camaraderie with each other and they invite their patrons to join in, which can make for a playful evening.   The menu offerings are largely conventional, let it suffice to say you are not going to The Saucer for food. The big pretzel with cheese is always my standby when the draught flows more than anticipated. There are a few great options to keep you occupied throughout your visit: Join the U.F.O. club, try your hand at a dart competition, shoot a game of pool in the back, or relish the trivia and live music several nights a week.   It is imperative that I elaborate on the sheer multitude of taps that twinkle like stars behind the bar. They beckon you over to try the trendy name of the month, or the same old lover you've had for years. It's a steep price per pint, and I like to be well acquainted with what I'm drinking. A good option, if you're not an ale aficionado, is trying the beer sampler to see which flavors perk your interest.   You can't say you've toured the University area without a stop at The Saucer. Experience that "certain something" it has on the competition and let me know what you think!

y3sQuensLNjcO_fWjZWCgg.text: I don't miss much about living in University Area- but this is one of the few gems that I do miss (and occasionally go back to)  The beer cheese soup is delicious. The beer menu is extensive. They have great specials. The waitresses wear cute short skirts. There is a lot to love about this place.  It is comfortable and laid back enough to bring a kid during the day. It gets rowdy at night.  The strip mall is a dreadful location- but that is to be expected in University Area. The outdoor area is ok.

qT_e5O96vp67LdA2zAjgbw.text: We had a work-team dinner here the last night I was in town so they set us up in the back room.  With such a large group, it was nice to move around from the couches to the tables so we could interact with everyone.    We had placed our order ahead of time and when we got there our appetizer cheese and meat trays were ready and waiting for us.  Those were great!  Not only did they have the sausage and cheese that we selected, there were also other goodies such as sliced apples and olives to go with it.  Plus, our server was amazing!  I'm bummed that I can not remember her name, however she was top-notch!  Answered all our questions with a smile, offered tastes for any sort of beer we were thinking about trying, and was always there when we needed her.  As far as food, I was most impressed with the cheese plate and the side salad.  The side salad was no leftover iceburg; I got some fresh spring mix and a few yummy toppings.  As far as my french dip, eh, it was a dip.  Meat, cheese, and bread . . . didn't "wow" me.    As most have said, come here for the beer and the energy and you'll enjoy every minute!

bFj0OMAdSeeuY-fl-ts0cQ.text: I love the Saucer, I just wish there were more locations.   Good for a pint after work but it gets very crowded at night. I have been going for years but I just recently joined the UFO club so you can catch me there most afternoons now.  Sunday Brunch is a must for club members but get there early enough to enjoy it.

RNW4H439G9JkJBvULp8H_A.text: as a girl, i love the saucer!  first, the food is pretty outstanding. jalapeno cheddar tater tots with habanero sour cream! the french dip is out of this world. burgers are also really good.  they have like 400 kinds of beers and you can get samplers called "flights" where you get maybe 2oz of 5 different beers by country or region (there is a german flight, a UK flight, a US flight, a NC flight, etc). there is also beer poker, where the 'tender selects a beer for you (for $2) if you're really into beer you can join their beer club and if you drink ALL the different beers then you get a numbered plate on the wall.  try the lost coast downtown brown-- i think it might be my favorite beer. a friend bought me a shot that the 'tender said tasted like a white gummy bear. the man didn't lie and the shot was fantastic.   the music played is great; a lot of 90's-00's. last time we went was a saturday night and there was live music going on.   and the girls wear super short plaid skirts (if you're into that sort of thing) :)

TzASKWYwmmOW7Rbo4peYkg.text: Great selection of beers. Not the best food but it's a beer bar after all. Was a better place when they had pool tables but not a bad place to watch a ballgame now.    Monday has really good specials for draft beers. And seasonal rotations offer great new selections.

7Kx4SW7KRv30KfNPFwURGw.text: Obviously, the beer selection here is great.  The waitresses are pretty good at giving suggestions, although can become a bit snobby when you keep ordering more beer.  I guess they just could have come off differently.  The food is okay, the sausages were kind of bleh.  The nachos were really small.  The pretzel was pretty good, I'd recommend that.  Good place to hit up if you have never been.

VdalRBCUzwPZnFMpESr4yw.text: Their beer selection is amazing...Waitresses are not always so great! Paige is really good through! She is super fast and never leaves you with an empty cup! Overall it is an amazing little place. I have never seen so many options for draft beers! If you go try the Rocket Tots, they are amazing!

ijx9m-i6av44qYr4bd3K8Q.text: The beer selection is amazing...definitely a place to check out if you are a beer person...all types of beer from all around the world...and I can't forget the food is pretty good too!

yjcPLyBOdlJJUElShMiX8Q.text: This place is the best beer bar I've been to in a long while.  Lots of good drafts and bottles from across the country, and good recommendations from the bartenders.  Traveling on business, the Flying Saucer is a good call for dinner and a real surprise for beer lovers.  The menu is dominated by sandwiches and burgers (in the $8-$9 range), but nothing really special.  I'd bring my wife back with me, but would leave the kids at home.  I'll be back for sure.  Follow up, a few months later.  I've actually been here twice since the first review.  The second time was pretty good, but I realized that the menu really doesn't offer much as far as 'real food' goes.  This last time was yesterday (Sun, 6/13) and the bartender was kind of an a-hole.  I think it was because I'm not a "local" as he was pretty condescending when I asked about the local beers.  I'll probably go back, but not for food and will avoid the brown haired putz pouring the beers.

K_K23cS-0zfKr8sCdzaSHw.text: Tons of beer...lost a star for, at best, avg food.

DGskvsE88g0yhilPFPmH2A.text: I'm not one for beer, but i have to give the Flying Saucer an awesome score. If i could do half points I'd give it a 4.5. The only thing i can say about he Saucer is that they are on top of it.  The staff is as friendly as a bar staff should be even when customers are being somewhat suggestive and just down right gross.   The menu promotes some typical bar fare, some that's good some that not so good. I recommend the beer cheese soup that comes in the bread bowl. Its smooth and creamy with just enough of a bitter bite and spice that let's you know its made with the restaurants name sake.   You won't find a lot of pampas jerks in this bar like other places in the university which make for a pretty nice time for the non-fratty crowd young and older alike. Try the standard Monday night Pint Night or Trivia through out the week. You will not be let down.

L7sTxdJhBE1XFDg5EVc8ZQ.text: This is a great neighborhood pub with a fantastic selection of great beers and nightly events/specials.  If you enjoy exploring the various tastes possible with diverse brewing styles, then this is the place for you.  Not only are there hundreds of beers available on tap and in a bottle, they also have a full menu.  The Hippie burger and the potato soup are great.  If you join the UFO club you receive opportunities for coupons, specials, events and free brunch every Sunday.  It's a great deal.

4XcPwjkIu5K87rQBNKeobA.text: Great beer selection.  Not a whole lot of women, but I guess thats not what its all about.  Pool tables in back, nice patio seating, big screen projector for sporting events.  Specials everyday.

bh2yzx_Hdrt4zrQx4uXHEA.text: The best place to get a beer in Charlotte, period. I used to live right down the road from the Saucer and went there several times a week in order to earn my own gold plate up on the wall (something you get after drinking 200 different beers). The selection is unmatched in the Charlotte area, and the wait staff is usually really knowledgeable about all the new beers they get in. Monday nights are $2.75 "pint nights" where everything on the wall (and we're talking nearly 100 beers here) is only $2.75, and considering the quality of some of these this is almost impossible to beat ANYWHERE!  The glass program on Wednesday night is really cool, and if you go to their website there is even a big trading community so you can find some pretty cool stuff that the local one doesn't offer. The tracking system they use is actually really great too. It's awesome to be able to see every beer you've ever had there, including the date, and your rating and comments about it.  The food at the bar is, well, bar food. If you're expecting something amazing for dinner here then you're definitely here for the wrong reason. While not quite as bad as you would expect, it's still the standard grease-laden goodies that just seem to go great with beer.  The one detriment to this place for me was that they allow smoking inside. I would dock them a point for this normally, but the reasonable person in me still realizes that it is a bar, and it is in NC, so it's almost allowable. The saving grace is that there is a great patio outside where you can go if cancer isn't your thing.  One final personal note: if you come here and order Bud Light (or some other equivalent) you're wasting space and need to be eradicated.

NMKjTx1-Allc7g5c3wjipg.text: I came to this town for a weekend so me and my friends decided to go bar hopping where this was one the best place for drinks. I mean they had a mean nachos but their variety of beer selections are off the wall.   So first stop after late lunch was here where we started off with dark beer which was pretty good. I forgot the name of it which means it did the job hahaha. When we arrived, this place was packed and I didn't want to wait so we just went to the bar and started with drinks. After couple of rounds, we thought it was a good idea to get some food so that beer can sync in.   We had a good bartender who provided drinks and food in timely manner however I kind of felt like she was really ignoring us and was busy gossiping with her coworkers who were serving the floor. None of us misbehaved so there no reason for us to ignore while giving more attention for gossiping. Granted they were busy but they had enough staff to take care of all of them.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States

xQXeB6URWyWLzNXatAN7AQ.text: The Flying Saucer has all tap beers for $3 on Mondays.  Offering something like 80 taps!  This weekly special has been going on for a long time and I hope they keep it going.  They also keep their beer list accurate and up to the minute, which enables the Knurder app to help you find the perfect beer.  They have a pretty good food menu.  We eat here a lot, and the food is consistently good.  Burgers, sandwiches, fries and stuff.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. Monday at the Saucer: $3 taps!  What&#39;s not to like? Solid NC beer for a cool winter night.

uI5HrKfI2r0DHI16cUHeIg.text: Lots of beer options to pick from. I had their saucer burger and their salad and it was really good. They also have good specials everyday. Thursday they had $8 flights which I really enjoyed because we could build our own.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. Build your own flights

vm3_vppl7iZprvfuCuwYEA.text: This place is the best thing ever. KC is the coolest person who works there and is always bringing good vibes to the table. Prompt service is always given and the loaded tots are the bomb dot com. Great pours and amazing people. Five thumbs up

XZTEJjKNOMq_XHGCeuZIlQ.text: Flying Saucer is your destination for craft beer in University City. It's not your average college bar. Yes it is a chain but each saucer is a bit different. When you walk in you know they mean business in terms of beer. Taps on taps on taps.   This place can get busy so show up early and grab a good spot. If there are any types of games going on expect somewhat of a crowd to be there. The layout of the restaurant is pretty open so it can get a bit loud in there. There is a back room with separate tables that can also be rented out for certain situations.   Make sure to show up on Monday's. All drafts are 3 dollars. Incredible deals on some really nice and rare beers. Ask the server about their plate program if you are serious about some craft beer!

-4-oyc_Ry2lvwJvaMT_UqQ.text: Terrible service, they wouldn't accept my perfectly valid ID. Can't speak to the food or drinks as they were not willing to serve me

0dNg2XxLzwQyt3PWKFuNtQ.text: Flying saucer, a beer drinkers paradise for years.  Before the craft beer BOOM, flying saucer knew what was up.  If you've been to one you've been to them all.  Good bar food.  Great beer selection.

79nim-Ph7qkE9whNjCPtKg.text: This bar sits virtually across the street from a major music venue.  We popped in a full two hours before the concert to grab a couple of apps and drinks to pre-game.  I was astonished that the bartender told as we sat down that appetizers in the kitchen were running over an hour behind.  Granted they were busy, but they weren't even at capacity.  Our group had a beer and a couple of shots and left.  Would have loved to of stayed and enjoyed the bar as the atmosphere looked pretty cool.  Their inability to keep up with the volume on a night that should be typical for them is unreal to me.  This bar needs to figure out a way to blast apps and finger foods to improve ticket times to satisfy the nearly nightly concert crowds.  They lost about $100 from our group that night based on their inability to serve us.

K-KyXFucjBPZwwu59RqBuw.text: Great selection of beer and the food is quite good as well! The staff is great and on top of it, always regulars there every time I've been so that's always positive!

fL_RTNqDALxG4hxNPv22OA.text: Great atmosphere!!!! Best beer here try the Dragon's milk if you like stouts that is your beer. Service is great!!!

pyP6-OFsHelYQ5ykGsDorA.text: Wide variety of beer. Best days to come are Sundays or Mondays. The food is okay but you really come for the beer. You can't go wrong with the rocket tots or the wings. Great place to relax and good beer.

3YkkNFq1BtekC33xcGBelA.text: Valentine's Day 2018 and yes, I'm on the road and in Charlotte, NC.  After a little research, I found my way to the Flying Saucer Draught Emporium on North Tryon Road.  What a cool place!!  Many different beers from which to choose and a great bar staff readily available to hook you up with just the right libation.  Neal is the best and will take care of you for sure!  I was seated at the bar next to a couple who drive 20 minutes to hang out here...that is indication enough that it is the place to go in Charlotte!  For dinner, I had the German Plate with 2 (perfectly grilled) bratwurst, potato salad, and a spicy jalapeno sauerkraut!  "Please sir, may I have some more?"  It was really good.  Enough said.  You get the picture.  Go to the Flying Saucer Draught Emporium in Charlotte, sit at the bar, have a bite.  I guarantee you won't regret it.

l5h-ChjeJoUBre5tqLwa4w.text: Always great when we come here for Carolina Rebellion!!!!!! Enjoy the beers on tap!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States

d2K8wnj0nWPpMfuTlVRsjA.text: If you like people, good bar food and lots of beer options, this a good place to go.  Had a solid burger and a good grapefruit beer which was the special that night.   It was also trivia night, so that added some fun.   Only seating available was at the bar, but the bartender was extremely attentive and pleasant in spite of a very busy restaurant.

ywS9wkbXiQTIq4zA3bAhaw.text: Quick sitting and friendly waitresses. There beer selection is out of this world (no pun intended). There is definitely something, more likely two or three things, for everyone.   The pizza was the best we have had down here. Super cheesey and gooey toppings yet the crust was still crunchy. Pepperoni we're crispy and it was hot.   The turkey meltdown was a good sandwich, plenty of meat and put together well.   Overall a good place for drinks and a quick bite to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey Meltdown
Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pizza
Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States

DHDlgcxTCSa2u4qM2uHdTA.text: This place is a great hangout with AMAZING service. The food is good, the selection is always interesting. A fun, chill environment and nice people make it worth visiting.

bzmnPC5PxJ2Ow4ccnvmhlA.text: Why even have a brunch menu if it's all gonna take an hour to come out? None of the food that was suppose to be warm was, horrible service couldn't wait to leave after a hour and a half.

ZXxywgW2vV2bi9fhIeU8Kg.text: There are sooo many other detailed reviews so I'll keep mine short.   The seating is self-seating so don't stand around for a hostess like I did.   There's a million beers here. No joking. There is something for everyone. They even have ciders and not your fathers root beer. Prices are fair. I didn't order any food since I didn't want bar food but the charcuterie boards looked amazing.   Service was very good. The only downside is that the TVs are on the smaller side and are super high up from the seating area.

Hvc6Hqz5mrTvCJ_E-rFlLA.text: This place makes me wish I lived closer to Charlotte! Perhaps they will put one in Lake Norman...  Both my fiancee and I joined the UFO club.   My thoughts: if you are going to be here more than once, it is worth the $18 to join the club. Shoot, even if you will never be back, you get a cool t-shirt when you join. But, if you will be back, your goal is to try 250 different beers. You can only add 3 every time you go, so all you crazy binge drinkers are just going to need to make multiple trips like the rest of us! (I jest, but it is nice to know they discourage binge drinking) What do you get after 250 different beers? A saucer on the wall. The coolest part, you get to add a quote to your saucer. So, start planning now! The other perk of the club: you get free brunch every Sunday. It's a fairly nice spread which includes scrambled eggs, sausage links, ground beef, muffins, and tortillas to turn any or all of that into a breakfast burrito. Not at all bad for free!  The best part: The amount of beers on hand, at any given time, tops that of most other restaurants and tap rooms! You will easily accomplish 250 beers without having to settle for beer you would rather not drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. Free brunch buffet

AZZ_8mdxQb4owasO0IUvAA.text: The Flying Saucer is a cool spot in the sea-filled chain restaurant University area.  There is a HUGE beer menu, which is what the bar and restaurant is known for.  Certain days of the week there are different beers on special.  There is an inside and outside seating area.  If you keep walking back, there is another large seating area that you'd never know was even back there!  We had a work function there over the holidays and got to try a lot of different appetizers.  The pretzels were definitely my favorite!  The other thing I liked a lot on the menu was the chicken wings.  I just didn't love the portion size, but the actual wings and flavor were great.    If you want to skip the chain restaurants and don't mind girls in short skirts check it out.

eMBrCLRXuqORP_zKolaRhw.text: Went there for the first time last Saturday. While the beer menu is impressive, being out of a couple of beers I wanted to try doesn't help. And our waitress, while cute and helpful, was new, so she needed our help in getting the right beers ordered.  We then ordered food. My GF's "Rocket Tots" were tasty, although she only got like... 14 of them for $6.99 so it wasn't a good value at all. I ordered a burger, which was the worst I've had since I moved to Charlotte in 2003. The meat had a sour, "off" taste, and the meat was cooked within an inch of its life. It was so dry that it was impossible to eat without liquid. What's more, I ordered it with Red Dragon cheese (and extra $1), and it was a depressing, congealed mass on top. The 9 fries that came with the meal were served at a less than ideal temp, but were nice and salty in spite of this.  The bottom line is that the waitresses are cute and in skimpy outfits, and the beer selection is good. But if you want to go here, eat somewhere else before you come. I'm also (literally) offended that the Flying Saucer charges 99 for their iPhone and Android apps... but that is neither here nor there.

2cpNhN4Gbue5APRUlm2M9g.text: Slow service. Horribly under staffed. Waited a while to get my order taken, food and bill. Even during football Sunday, really need to hire more people and turn up the volume on the TV.

VeCHWtSQxgkHnG2HZAI9KQ.text: Awesome employees, amazing beer selection, you don't get ignored even if they're busy, the food is top notch, it's in a great location, and it's always clean. Can't get much better than that.

1rojaM0TMi-v373MOGokRg.text: Had my first visit to the Saucer a few weeks ago for a Trivia night. Beer selection is awesome and you'll find the prices reasonable too! Menu is great and this Cheesehead was very happy to see all the Brat menu items, including the Brat Nachos I started with! Had the chicken cheesesteak for me meal and it was pretty good, though the meat to bread ratio favored the bread.  As for Trivia - they run a tight ship and it's a blast! The MC is really good and calls out all potential cheaters. Love it! I'll be back again soon when I'm in the University Area.

DLWY1F4VQ-2QLoMy3-M0LA.text: Holy crap! How have I not written a review for this place yet?! I'm here easily once a week! They have a great selection of beer and the wait staff is WONDERFUL. They're friendly and funny and if they have time, will usually sit down with you for a couple of minutes to talk and laugh. There are one or two waitresses ( the second may have left) who seem to favor certain groups over others and have given pretty lackluster service every time we have been. There's one in particular who seems to favor groups of guys over our group (probably because she thinks they'll tip better) which I think is a huge mistake on her part because I always tip 25-30% or more, even for just average service. When I went a few days ago, we had this waitress. We planned on getting three beers and some food but since she didn't seem interested in getting us drinks until we were out of beer, taking our food orders, or even just checking up on us in general, we sat there for two hours and only got two beers. If I had this experience my first time there, I never would have returned, but thankfully the other waitresses make up for it. They're wonderful company and always give really good recommendations for new beers.   Their food is delicious. Try the soft pretzels with warm cream cheese-chive dip. Or the spinach artichoke dip. Or the queso. Lauren's Goat Cheese Salad is terrific too, along with the sandwiches. The only food I have an issue with is the hummus. I'm not big on spicy hummus and  theirs has some spice mixed in that I just personally don't like. Someone else might though. Just a personal preference.  And I cannot say enough about the beer. I have had a Crem Brulee Stout. I have had a maple bacon beer. I have had beers that most people generally could not fathom. The lowest price on any beer is $3, but it's always worth it. They have a very wide selection and if you're a beer nerd, you should really consider joining their UFO club and becoming a Beer Knurd. After 200 beers, you get a plate on the wall with your name and as crazy of a quote as you can think of. It's really fun to stare at all the plates on the ceiling after a few beers too.   All in all, despite the tiny issues of the spicy hummus and the waitress that gives biased service, this place is still deserving of the 5 stars. Their trivia night is also always challenging, but very fun :-) Oh and they allow dogs on the patio so we bring ours every once in a while.

-JdSyMga-73nxWvpbPLZ7g.text: Great food, very impressive draught beer selection with lots of excellent local beers. Waitresses were outstanding. Our regular stop to and from Raleigh.

_ojhPAZHfnvDkStfPLYeTw.text: Bailey and Erika are amazing! They are so attentive and so personable! They both let us know all of the awesome specials throughout the week. I will definitely keep coming back. And their UFO club is awesome! Gives me a reason to sample all of the beer types and try something new everytime I come. Hands down best bar in Charlotte.

Au6O1v28d0fI6IydOYDNUw.text: We come here often. Great beer, good food, friendly service. Good place to go for a relaxing and fun atmosphere, where you can have a conversation.

cMD9eEupWdOfOy_edxqKmA.text: Ding Ding Ding!  We have a winner.  This is the best beer  brewery/tastery/deliciousry/savory place in all of Charlotte.  Well, at least I think so.  I just wish it was a little closer to Uptown (where I roam).  It is located up near UNC-Charlotte where I dont think the college youth truly respect good beer.  They are drinking the natty ice and PBRs of the world while this place serves over 300 better options.  Just sad.  Seriously, when you walk in to this place you are figuratively smacked in the face with originality.  They do it all their way and you either love it or you don't.  I became a UFO member in about ummmmm 3 mins and 32 seconds.  $18 and you get a free Tshirt, membership card, and free brunch every Sunday 12pm-3pm for the rest of your life.  The brunch alone is worth it.  I went for beer on a Saturday and came back for brunch the next day.  The other perks are listed on the website and take a little time to accomplish.. Like try 200 different beers and get a $100 tab and your name forever enshrined on a plate on the wall.  I'm going for it!!   Don't care about joining the BeerKnurd club... Thats cool too.  Just go on in and try the pretzel.. Let me rephrase that... YOU HAVE TO TRY THE PRETZEL.. I grew up in the Philadelphia area and we are used to brick pretzels.  Though the sad thing is that we like them.  Here, you get two huge... soft... fluffy.. wonderful pretzels.  How can someone be so excited about a pretzel, you ask??  Just trust me and order it.  Enjoy!  -Ian M.

Hi03elOJ72YZeaHk1oPUaQ.text: Love flying saucer, can get a little loud or which I'm not a fan, but you can find so many delicious beers. I don't turn it down when someone wants to go. I recommend the bratwurst plate, my favorite.

ZGXa5kmpxHNYm8mKfMqAHQ.text: What can I say, I am a beerknurd.  Honestly I love this place.  Yes, some of the beers can get pricey, but there is nowhere else around that offers this combination of beer selection, atmosphere and service.  The beer selection is fabulous, there are so many great beers and many varieties.  It's a beer lover's paradise.  The atmosphere inside suits me.  It's dark, dark furniture, dark walls, covered with plates of course.  If you like a bright cheery clubish atmosphere, this isn't for you.    The food is pretty good.  It's a little different than your standard bar fare.  The rocket tots are really good, so are the pretzels and most of the sandwiches.    I've been here many times, and the service, IMO, has always been excellent.  Even when I've gone at peak times, these girls know how to handle it.  In my experience it's been very rare that I've had to flag down a server, they are almost always on top of their game here.  I definitely recommend this place if you are a beer fanatic.  You won't be disappointed.

mOEySbLZXPVySZlnwLQrMw.text: Great set of Drafts available. Great atmosphere for drinking. Its usually crowded on weekdays and weekends are worst.

F30ZoTivzp9FP4nb_erPHQ.text: Being a loyal fan of beer and an occasional alcoholic, it's kind of embarrassing to admit that i've only been here twice in the few years of living in Charlotte.   We started with the two soft pretzels with queso and spicy mustard. Not a fan of the mustard at all, but the queso was decent. Anything with pretzel salt is delicious to me, but these pretzels made me question why i don't eat pretzels more often, they were soft and delicious. i also tried the buffalo chicken wrap and was pretty satisfied. It had good spice and i enjoyed that they threw in a little carrot/cucumber in there. (note to self reminder: sub ranch for blue cheese minus cilantro).    The main reason to come here if you haven't heard is for the beer. They have an extensive beer list that is tough to beat anywhere else. It looks like Monday is the best day to enjoy cheaper beer, $3 for most beers.  i enjoyed a few including Big Boss Aces & Ates, Sam Adams Winter, Foothills Seeing Double IPA, and my current favorite Olde Hickory Black Raven IPA. i opted to join the UFO club to begin the journey of getting my name on the wall or ceiling...If nothing else, i paid $18 for a t-shirt and a membership card. Fair enough.     We came with a group for a little unofficial Yelp event on trivia night and we won first place...no big deal.

pUY4QsqbalHx2cmGX_KOIw.text: I feel like sometimes the saucer is over rated but maybe that's because sometimes I just want a Miller Lite

WSY9JIzB1PPoMRGi_B7wEQ.text: If you are a beer connoisseur, you need to go here.    Personally, I love this bar.  This place is 5 miles from my office and 5 miles from my house, no wonder I made it to 200 beers so easily!    The Flying Saucer literally has approximately 300 unique beers, with at least 100 on tap, and some of them are rotating beers.  Additionally, they have daily specials, like pint night with $3 pints and biggie beers for the price of a pint and even beer poker.  Their loyalty program is also rad, drink 200 unique beers and get a $100 tab on the house to have a party with your friends (I'm 421).  Fear not non-beer drinkers, they also have liquor drinks.    Their food menu is decent, I mean, it's bar food...The pretzels with queso dip are the best!  And the scenery, aka the waitresses, aren't bad to look at either...in their school girl uniforms.  They have pool tables in the back and good music streaming, unless a crappy band happens to be playing.  If a band is playing and there is a cover, Beer Knurd members get in for free.  Prost!

MqgLoO-J3y6ity-I73UmlQ.text: The biggest beer selection anywhere in NC (aside from the Saucer in Raleigh, of course); Local, National, International beers are all represented. Fun specials like 'beer poker' where you get bottled beer for cheap (waitress' choice) or local beers cheaper than usual on certain days. There is a gimmick for every day of the week, and they are actually interesting and make you want to come again another day of the week.  The waitresses are dressed as schoolgirls, but are highly beer-educated. They can suggest beers to you that maybe you wouldn't have tried before, and bring endless samples as well.  The food is good (Rocket Tots are great, the soft pretzels are phenomenal, the best I have ever had, and consistently)  Newly non-smoking (as are all NC places now) and friendly atmosphere.  A small complaint is it can be busy around 9pm or later as a band starts playing LOUDLY, so keep that in mind; also around lunch time during the weekend often people bring their babies (They bring a BABY to a BAR!) which is annoying if you like to say the F word or talk about your hot hole.

v6LbaNnPzT9XAiexDL993w.text: If you are looking for good food and a great beer selection this is the place. They have a beer for everyone's taste, and if you're not sure what you want the staff can help you out. Join the beer club and start the tasty journey to receiving your plate.

rMqWPcEwfnUZ-f8coYHEsA.text: First let me disclose that I joined their beer club.... So, you know it must be good.  Still, despite my membership, I do not visit that much because it is always overcrowded and very hard if not impossible to get any seating during popular times ( Friday, Saturday, certain week nights).   Seating is a first come, first served basis so you really do have to fight to get a seat when one becomes available.  People are freaking aggressive!!  So, make sure you wear your running shoes and maybe a helmet.  The last two times I went I ended up leaving with out eating or getting a beer.  Once I had friends with me and after waiting 45 minutes, gave up on getting any seats.  The other time I went with my wife and my 18 year old cousin and we had to leave the premises because despite being a restaurant, if you are under 21, you must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian.  Seems stupid since they ID and there is no way we would have let her drink anyway.  Bullshit aside, this is a fun place if you manage to get seated.  There is an immense selection of beers.  In fact, there is nearly anything you could possibly want.  I am craving a beer thinking about it!  The food is pretty good too!  I have had most everything on the menu and have enjoyed it all.  Aside from the beer, it is the atmosphere that sells the place.  Picture a cozy pub, sometimes with a live band, plates all over the walls and ceiling - mostly to do with the beer club,  hot young women in tight shirts and plaid skirts, etc..  The only thing I would improve is the building itself.  It should be 3x the size and maybe have an upstairs that is like a huge wraparound balcony so you can see and be part of all the action below.

_u6fccV_PELN1zPJxn5dqA.text: This place was ok.  It had its good points and bad points.  First off, if you don't know where it is, it's super hard to find.  It's kind of tucked in a corner and you don't see it really until you are right in front of it.  They had a great beer selection and a lot of the beers I had never even heard of.  I liked how they had them grouped on the menu.  The brats I had were good but the service sucked.  It took forever for my cousin and I to get waited on and the waitress didn't seem that friendly.  I'd probably give it another chance because I liked the beer selection.

NQMWQdQSW07XqmeFfMTj7w.text: Good food and drinks before going to a concert at the verizon wireless amphitheatre up the street. ~Cheers

m01echa6poNeX3c9j0LSpg.text: I've been coming to the flying saucer on and off for years, they always have a great selection of rotating draft beer as well as a wide selection of bottles and cans. They don't serve liquor, but with the selection they do have, you are sure to find something that you will like. They have different specials on different days and usually have a couple beers on "fire sale" if you want to save a couple bucks. If you want to join their ufo club I believe it's free to join, and after you drink 200 different beers you get a plate party which gets you a $100 to spend on food and drinks, as well as your own plate on the wall.  Food is also served here in case you get a case of the munchies while imbibing, I recommend the soft pretzels! They have tvs on the walls usually on sports channels, as well as projector and big screen. They have darts as well, in case you get bored just sitting at the bar, and occasionally there is live music. It's near the UNCC campus, so expect to see college students here often. It can get loud inside when they're busy, especially since the walls are covered in plates.  The staff is friendly and helpful and the place is pretty clean. If you like sampling all sorts of different beers, this just might be the right place for you!

P0JPJrIdZu12MolZeXW-iQ.text: We'll see how long the current streak continues, but I have to give props where props are due!  My last 4x in I have had all my beers correctly tallied & applied to my totals! Huzzah!!! I'm now just 16 away from my 6th plate, so I'm getting really excited about the approaching Plate Party!  Also, I had accidentally left my credit card in a check-booklet on my last visit and the Mgr w/whom I'd previously had the not so great encounter was actually very pleasant and got me my card on my next visit. So, mayhaps he was just having an off day when I had brought my concerns about not being correctly credited for my beers on multiple visits to his attention?  In any case, for the moment at least, this Saucer location has regained my affections! Hope they can keep the streak alive and I can proudly hang my plate by Oct!

0AnSmt3_Dlxp6u_fbiX3lQ.text: This is UNC Charlotte's quintessential bar.  Flying saucer has classic pub food and an incredible selection of craft beer.  Definitely a good place to stop after work for a drink or two!  Ask about their plate/saucer program and get your name on the wall!

oO_rGy5lzy0JI9ixQxmcuQ.text: Great place but avoid Casey at all cost  Terrible attitude and service  Talks back all the time  Rude and totally unprofessional No idea why they would keep her Offends more than she helps  Use to come in for lunch but don't any longer because she is always there at that time

6WmKQEempw5lvLUoAmj7tg.text: Awesome place nice ppl to sit and relax  Always busy and have deals everyday.. Very nice friendly attentive staff peaceful music ..

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States

ixMOly_OyvwJ7kWztRfD-Q.text: It's been a year and I've finally made it back. Last visit here we only had a couple of beers and left. This time around we arrived with appetites in tow and were ready for some lunch.   I went with the Saucer Burger which was a Blank Angus burger along with usual condiments, mustard, mayo, lettuce, tomato, red onion and then topped with Pepper Jack cheese. I added bacon as well because... well it's Bacon darn it! The burger was delicious and served with shoestring fries.  I really enjoyed it and the Purple Haze washed it down easily.   The service was great. I don't recall the name of our server however she was on the ball and answered all of our questions easily. Especially when we inquired about the saucers on the walls and what the various color differences indicated. I can say without hesitation if I lived in Charlotte I would be visiting here on a regular basis and I look forward to coming back in 2019.

T6-Wk8WeC4YUFALcag8m9g.text: I absolutely love this place! It is an awesome pub and great place to chat with some friends. The saucer offers a wide variety of beer selections from local to imported beers. I find the service is always great and the servers very knowledgeable about the different beer styles. They also have food and I particularly like their San Miguel burger with a fried eggs and avocado. Another favorite of the food is the huge pretzels with mustard or cheese sauce.  So if you like the pub scene with great beer as the focal item and great food, stop by the saucer!

Rh44sfMoqFY_MpzbUBHmFw.text: What a nice spot near UNC Charlotte! I landed in the afternoon and had some work I needed to do before retiring for the night. I was not in the mood for coffee, especially because I wanted to sleep that night. I was very glad that I was able to open up my laptop (I travel with a Mifi so I can get Internet wherever I am) and worked at their bar.   To start, they have an EXCELLENT beer selection, both on tap and in bottles. My bartender allowed me to taste small portions of a few beers to help me decide which one I wanted a pint of. I was excited to try several local draft beers.  I started with a salad which was quite refreshing. I then went less wholesome and had the chicken tender basket. While listed under "starters," it is a meal of itself. You get 3 large chicken tenders with a large portion of shoestring fries.

ZI2qe5bpYXyS89ube4C6kw.text: I've been coming here for years but today was one of the best.  Waitress was awesome, food was on point and beer was...who cares...it's beer!

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. Does this photo need words?

XTXH9FNikHbJqm3mzY_gkg.text: Literally the best pizza I've had in my entire life. It was arugula prosciutto and literally mood changing! Wish this bar was a little more first time visit friendly maybe signs of seat yourself. Lots of great beers on draft and my hubs loves the Carolina burger. Cool specials that change often. Will absolutely be back! Great place to watch a game! Maybe not for socializing though because it's pretty loud

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. Prosciutto arugula pizza

kJRI2PL2BhKH5b2t-bOVEQ.text: This place had a super cool atmosphere. (See pics for cool atmosphere) We met our friends for drinks here and i highly recommend the effen cucumber mule. Our server Kelsey was attentive and super nice. Would recommend

vupDAXDX3hiPCe3Haxj8iw.text: The server was great, the food was meh. I got the blue burger and it was dying for some salt. My friend had the nachos appetizer and they were awful and begging for some sauce/queso. Drinks were strong but overall everything was just ok.

0_xU6dIydVoOUKXGGKNXmw.text: I will go here any day we plan for brunch! Everything is really good and big quantity! I don't recommend most of their mocha and coffees.I honestly hated them but the fresh juice is great! Service is amazing! I have only gone on weekends so it's always very crowded.i like to be seated outdoor in the back much peaceful there! I'll be going back soon

JRiUQsXYREWWOv69FEATSA.text: Not your typical sports bar! Yes they have TV's, food and beer however the decor is not what you would expect. They have saucers and pictures all over the bar. They have a great beer selections. Both on tap and in bottles/cans it was almost overwhelming. They have a decent variety of food. I got the saucer bratzel and it wasn't what I was expecting. However it was delicious and filling.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. Saucer bratzel

efwgwxjEfMoCP5ztRxW5OA.text: What can I say about this place? The food got a thumbs down from us. The fries were hard and over cooked and the nachos were definitely not what we wanted. We are not beer drinkers but I'm pretty sure the beer selection was great. We both ordered a Moscow Mule but it was served in a regular glass instead of the wonderful copper mug we were expecting. The quality of the drink was good but minus the copper mug. At least I can say I tried this place but I doubt I will be returning. The service was decent and It was fun watching the people come in and out of the "highlife" store next-door from the window. And I don't mean hi as in hello. Lol. Yes I did check in there after my visit here because I had to see what was going on in there! LOL Curiosity.

LBIpYUxVLRTZo6hsO_Im2Q.text: Where the beers are plenty! Very hard to decide but you can do flights or a tasting if you don't know what your beer fancy is.  Sat at the bar, Kept eyeing up a margarita that was on special so went on a limb and got a margarita even though I love beer! Hubby got a beer though!   Monday's are $3 every draft will definitely have to come back for that special!
