cnk2U2PSgVvW7289gom-3Q.text: If you're a beer kinda person, I HIGHLY recommend Flying Saucer. Drink all the beers they have, you'll get an awesome plate up on their wall of fame! Service is quick and friendly. Their food is really good too.

bBF3SG7Olr0R1DVG29Or9A.text: Incredible selection.   But don't expect much from the waitresses.  They're hired to be eye candy.....not for their waitressing abilities.  Great beer, terrible service.

VyboY8zzvi3_ZPKDh2RJwA.text: Love the atmosphere and selection of beers. Enjoyed several appetizers (pretzels were the best I ever had)and our waitress was very pleasant and helpful.

QycbkP0HMu2WfsT2NADhYQ.text: Unfortunately I was really upset here..... The beer selection was solid but the ID Nazi sucked. Three 36 year olds were ID'd.... COOL, but to try and find ways to say we don't have "proper" ID when we had 2-3 other forms of ID is just ridiculous. I get the laws, I do.... to stop underage drinkers and whatever.... we are approaching 40 so  AND THEN say "I'll ask the manger" rolling her eyes and the manager says we are fine. Lol. Ummmm, is he breaking the law by letting us drink or are you just being an ass and trying not to serve us. Anyways, it's sad to say that we will not be returning, when we drink A LOT and just moved down the street. Lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States

7opPHwTPnwrAtQ8ESVMgUA.text: In honor of completing our first year of grad school (celebration was a few weeks late but so what) some friends and checked out this place.  We had all heard of it but none of us had been before.  All we knew was that it was a place for us to have a drink or two or three.  Who's counting.    My friends are beer connoisseurs or enthusiasts if you will.  I on the other hand am not.  I don't know the first thing about beer except that what I've had in the past I didn't like.  Fruity cocktails are more my speed.  So, I was thinking to myself great I'm going to have to sit here and watch my friends celebrate as I sip on a Sprite.  Woohoo!  Lo and behold there are mixed beer combos that are sweet.  Yay!!! Who knew.  Maybe you did but I sure didn't.    I had the Hummingbird H20 and it was yummy.  I then tried the Snakebite which wasn't as yummy but it wasn't terrible.  Our server was great and really knowledgeable about all of the drinks (the Snakebite wasn't her recommendation for me but I was being adventurous).  Which is quite impressive since there are hundreds to choose from.    Greatest part was that the drinks were cheap.  Only $5 a piece for my tall glasses of brew.  Definitely a great place to chill with good people and kick back a few.  There's also a full menu.  Always best to drink on a full stomach just something I learned over the years :-)

7wx9fslyknXR5fyYeA6UsA.text: Tremendous selection of beers.  Fun atmosphere. Had the double brats with german potato salad.  The brats were excellent and the potato salad was the best I've ever had, including the german restaurants I've been to back home.  My wife had the Stroganoff burger which was outstanding.  I'm getting that next time!

yl7NXEnsdmU6iV_n9deBkw.text: Always a great place to hangout with friends! Many of my college memories are associated with this place. Great atmosphere. Great servers(and beautiful as well ).

skkhskEXOO3uDcAf0rASTw.text: This is my first time to the Flying Saucer.  They have a lot of draft and bottled beers, a lot of locals and a lot of imports (from other parts of the world and US).  They have a large bar and lots of tables.  There are good decorations and a nice atmosphere for friends or small groups.  However!! I work in a restaurant that actually sticks to the health code!  That means no nail polish!  No dipping glass cups into the bucket of ice since little pieces of glass (or big pieces) can very easily chip off and get lost in the ice and only be found again when they scrape someone's throat.  For this same reason, glasses are not suppose to be stacked for any reason- the inside will get chipped and the spare glass can end up in someone's mouth.  Also, it can chip the outside of the glass which can cut someone's hand.  Lastly, bar fruit (aka limes, lemons, and oranges) are meant to be kept on ice and handled with tongs.  I saw the opposite of all these things at TFS.  The fruit was left on the counter and I even saw a customer reach his hand in from this side of the bar and grab an Orange slice.  I saw servers and bartenders doing the same thing.  The food tasted ok but based on their 92.0 sanitation score and what I saw going on front of house, I'm kind of worried to eat here again.

0Cv4PvvT44jMiGkXugj-yw.text: Really had fun. The food is great and the staff are really nice and attentive. The selection of beer is just crazy large and staff is fairly knowledgable about the beer and can even make great recommendations.

SvfNfadScgixElT-zuGCUg.text: I love this location! I come here pretty often for the large selection of local and foreign beer they offer, and for the amazing pretzels. The Flying Saucer has amazing hot soft pretzels! The bar is usually pretty busy, so don't expect to get fast service, however the staff is very friendly.

gMHum0YzDqVWAtcvZDAuYg.text: A penny-lined wall of taps. Egyptian Pharaohs watching from the bar (who, for you historical types, the Egyptians fed their children bread and beer). And walls and ceilings covered in plates, physical manifestations of the most ambitious revelry of those who grace the dark-stained wooden stools. You see, for each flying saucer above your head, a person has had at a minimum of 200 beers at that bar.  The Saucer is a staple in University City and has the best beer selection in East Charlotte, hands down. Local brews? Check. Big-name crafts? Check. Imports galore? Check. During the school year it can be overrun by UNCC undergrads, but hey, you have to learn how to drink somewhere, right?  Come have a beer, join the UFO club, and start working your plate!

YdAlf2O5BFlbmk5YdoWM5A.text: Great place for a happy hour after work (it's near where I work, Univ Research Park) or a beer during the day or a night out.  Selection is excellent, some of the servers are good with recommendations, others not so much.  They carry many of my favorite beers and I have also found some great new ones here as well.    Food is pretty good, I go there more for the beer, so there's that.  I typically stick with the pretzels, they are phenomenal, get the regular queso, the cream cheese based dip will harden as it cools.  They have good lunch specials, 5.99 on weekdays for a specific sandwich plate each day.  The club is my favorite lunch special.

Dqu5oJXrre2D0dqsCYnmLw.text: Great atmosphere and awesome beer selections. Wait staff was friendly. Food was mediocre unfortunately. The burgers came out well done. Waitress never even asked us how we wanted them cooked. This makes me believe the burger were previously frozen. The German potato salad had a big pool of oil at the bottom of the cup. Yes the German potato salad is made with oil, but this was an excessive amount. Would maybe come back but wouldnt have a burger or the potato salad again.

9x9BZFurKP1_07x5k_IP5g.text: i've had this several. the staff seems to be a bit distracted most of the time which makes it hard to get an order in but the beer is endless and good and the girls are smokin hot. Pet friendly outside. The food isnt so bad. Also cool promos and glasses.

msBDdovTjQBlMNVcEjCNWA.text: Been going here a few years now and I'm working on my second plate.  The best beer selection in Charlotte, I don't think you can find a place that has more beer on tap.  The food has always been good.  I love getting the rocket tots.  Overall the service is good.  If you're a beer person you need to go to this place.  You'll enjoy yourself.

U63emUlRy8B7sSqwlEmy3A.text: I'm a regular at the Austin saucer, and I really like this one too. The waitress was exceptionally helpful and friendly. I was impressed by the variety of pumpkin beer they had and the crepes were as good as in Austin. This saucer gets extra win points because a guy celebrating his plate party was in a giant bear costume and I got to be a part of that.

C_l0yaz8lz3ALh3qPe5Csw.text: Great idea, good menu, service is inconsistent, prices are slightly high for beer, average for food.  So there are different aspects of this place.  First off, the menu.  Their menu is very vegetarian friendly.  Hummus, spin-art dip, soft pretzels, tater tots, pizza, cheese plates, 2 veggie sammies, some salads and a Spicy Beer Cheese Soup that I wish I had tried.  So I definitely give credit to a place that tries to be veg-friendly.  I ordered the Hippie Burger (veggie patty).  It was OK.  But the thing was that it came with a side, and I asked the server if the potato salad had bacon in it.  She said no.  But the first bite had bacon in it.  So, I'll just say that I was very dissatisfied with that.  Whatever, I kept trucking.  And anyways, the real reason to go to this place is the beer.  I'm sure other reviewers have gone into great detail about their gigantic beer selection, so I'll keep it short.  While the idea is great, it falls a little short.  While the size of the menu is supposed to be its selling point, its just too big!!!  And it has a lot of filler.  I noticed one reviewer who said that this is the biggest beer selection in NC.  Well, maybe, but biggest is not necessarily best (innuendo unavoidable :)  It's hard to take a lot of pride in a beer bar that has a bunch of macros and second rate micros, but (if my eyes don't deceive me) not a single saison?  And barely any lambics to speak of.  Whatever, they still have some pretty good stuff, I'm just being picky, but it seems like with a little quality control their selection could go from good to great.  This one was a little tough to rate.  Part of me wants to give it a 2 (bacon), part a 3 (atmosphere), part a 4 (beer and food menu), and part a 5 (the idea).  So take that 3 I gave it according to what you want out of this place.  Oh yeah, this place can be REALLY loud inside.  Like uncomfortably loud, so might want to grab seat outside if that bothers you.

lvUzGCDfm1jFAZ2ay7ZkHw.text: Went to the Saucer prior to catching a concert at Verizon Wireless and met up with my two favorite people (Nikki and Bryan).  They arrived before me and were sipping on some beers.  Bryan had a Seeing Double (I sipped it, delicious!) and Nikki had a Purple Haze, on special for $3.... What a deal!  The service was good, but a bit on the slower side. We placed our order for food and while I ordered a side salad in place of fries with my burger--- and it didn't arrive that way---it was quickly corrected! We had these Rocket Tots as an appetizer and the jalapeno sour cream they serve them with is perfect!!!  Really enjoyed those spicy tots! :). My burger was great, too and so was the salad.  Overall, a great place in the University area to come chill and have a pint-or three- and have some good bar food.

PVLuqxtiknVUTj83XuIOXA.text: For a fun, low key hang out, I've gotta give this place 5 stars.  I think for bar food, it is terrific!  So far I've tried the cheese fries, spinach and artichoke dip, and their pizza (with bratwurst, mmm).  I can't find anything that I think is mediocre.  It's always been better than expected.  As for the beer - I can't think of anywhere else you can go to find as many selections.  I'm not a huge beer drinker (check out my profile - Bacardi always makes my party :p ).  However, that being said, I've had some pretty damn good ones here!  On Monday it is $3 pint night and on Thursdays they feature a $3 beer.    On top of the good food and drink, Flying Saucer also does Trivia nights, DJ nights, and live music nights!    Not a huge fan of the servers in mini skirts but I have a feeling that may be a gender related bias :)

LbKyt1V5GkFUrNarglQqvw.text: Great place for beer lovers the best selection I have seen.  The plate for 200 beers cool concept. The staff is nice and know their beers.  Good service and fair prices.  The food is only ok. The ambience is fun. Overall  a great place to drink.

-yX_h8_rsrN51F7CIRxHyA.text: Awesome waitress.  Awesome concept.  Awesome beer.  Awesome appetizers.  Pretty good food.  Not AMAZING, but good.  Really liked the atmosphere.  A great time.

Qbe_mOUDmTUPvsplz2644Q.text: Not a great selection of beer for a place called a "Draught Emporium".  Also the food was less than mediocre and they were out both chicken tenders and pizza when we were there.  There are a lot of much better places to get craft beer and bar food in Charlotte.

aLe_cjgEtQZ93mV5TEAR8Q.text: Situated on the corner of a strip mall, this place is fairly easy to find.  The atmoshpere is that of a fairly traditional pub. Lots of dark wood lines the walls and the place is covered in saucers, some merely decorative and others representing those in the "UFO Club". There is an area for live music, and a couple of dart boards, I did not wander around or to take in the entire place, but I was told that there is an area with billiard tables as well. Really, it's a nice change from some of the Charlotte area drinking establishments that lack character and are littered with TV's...  The service was terrific. The waitresses are wearing school girl outfits, complete with tiny little plaid skirts, knee high argyle socks, and skin tight tank tops. Somewhat similar to the outfits worn by the Tilted Kilt girls. Quite appealing. Aside from thier appearance the wait staff seem to have at least a rudimentary knowledge of the beers on thier list.  The beer selection was outstanding, somewhere around 100 taps, and at least as many bottles covering a wide array of styles. If only they planned thier food menu as well.  The food was uninspired, and fairly plain. Fairly standard chain pub fare, and not terribly well executed at that. Not that the food was bad, just not terrific. And definately not worth the prices.  They do have some specials, I think they have a couple of days a week where drafts are $3, but overall I found the beer and food pricing to be a bit high.  Overall, I would definately go back. The atmosphere and the extensive draft list are alluring, even if the food is not.

3-47W-tpuHgETH7EVZaTbQ.text: I went back and forth for a while on 4 or 5 stars. As you can see, I couldn't justify only giving 4, I really can't think of anything I don't like about this place.  First of all, this is where I met my wife, she was sitting at the bar drinking water. Water?!?!? With all those incredible draft selections, she was drinking water. I should have known something was off right away! lol Anyways back to the Saucer, draft beer menu, some really good bar quality food, pool tables. Great seating, inside & out. I don't know if they still have open mic nights, but back when I was coming regularly Mondays were open mic, a lot of fun. Wednesdays were always pint nights, where you get a glass included to take home! A lot has probably changed, but i'm sure its the same great friendly atmosphere, with incredible friends, and great beer.

8AF8JZNxMmf9bl75VOCGAQ.text: I can't believe I haven't yelped on the Flying Saucer yet! I used to go to another one all the time in college, then moved away to a city that didn't have one, but now I'm back to a city that has one! Yeah!  First of all, I want to go on the record that we NEED A FLYING SAUCER IN UPTOWN! It would be so busy and popular, it's just what Uptown needs!   I love this place for their: Great Beer Selection, Great Beer Specials (there's always something on sale or a special), and Yummy Food! Esp the pretzels, so great! Sandwiches, salads, apps, they have a little bit of everything.   The waitresses are friendly, knowledgeable about beer and always quick to bring you a refill. I wish they had live music more often, but maybe I'm never there at the right times.   Anyway, I highly recommend this place if you're looking for a new place to sip a pint - and I want to sign the petition to move them Uptown!

ScxMTB_NNCmj6yxHsdP-Kg.text: If you can't find a beer you like in this place, something is wrong with you. They have everything under the sun so it's virtually impossible. After going there many a time, I decided to venture in there last wknd during the day for food alone. It was pretty empty on a Saturday afternoon which surprised me with college football starting up and all. There was two other tables there besides ours and the service sucked for that so I'm confused why the service was bad.  I got the bratwurst nachos and were disappointed when they came out because they werent traditional piled nachos but single nachos laid on a plate with the toppings on top. Um, when I want nachos, I want a big fatty greasy pile of nachos thank you. They were tasty and came with  jalapeno sour cream  on the side but I wanted a stack of them so boo.  They have free wi fi-you know if you want to take your computer to a bar and get your wi fi on. Even though I wasn't completely sold on their food or service, I will be back and will stick with beer.

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bratwurst Nachos

ZmzsFxjOF7wpzY68NDAX2Q.text: Place was packed on a Wednesday night. Bartenders were probably the most attentive and friendly that I've met in awhile. Bartenders were very knowledgeable about the different beers and made good suggestions. Food was good and the beer selection was mind blowing. Would definitely go back again.

OuWW9GFbmS5jw0WIlI_6EQ.text: Ive been here on several occasions and overall its safe to say that ive had a great experience everytime.  The staff is attentive and is always readily available to refill your glass. They have an amazing beer selection that could suit to pretty much anyones taste. I havent explored the food menu to deeply but the pretzels are great as well as the cheese fries. Ill definitely be back.

SmG3mhnCiQBvOnUMP5ZFBQ.text: When I said I wanted to get some sausage and couple of beers, I didn't expect to end up here.  Yes, the male to female ratio is a bit out-of-control, but this is not what I meant by a "sausage house."  Oh well.  The Saucer is tough not to like...unless you hate beer and short skirts.  What I find most amusing about the Saucer...is the opportunity it presents to its patrons.  You can earn your own plaque on the wall for drinking copious amounts of beer...showing how big of an alcoholic you are.  This is sort of like a Yelper checking in to the liquor store every time they visit.  Hey everybody...look at how much I drink...lol!  So maybe I have a plaque...whatever..."Don't judge me Earl!"  Old "They Call Me Earl" quote free of charge.  The food at the saucer is...wait...they have food here?  Yea, that's what I came for...the food...wink.  Try:  Anything Corsendonk  Avoid:  Bringing the battle axe

stg0ymmG5aFkq6TfK3fxfQ.text: There's not much I can add that hasn't been said about the Flying Saucer. They've got your bar standards: tons of choices on tap, some dart boards, trivia night, sometimes even live music and with the Uni right across Tryon they've found themselves in the perfect locale.  Where they raise the bar is with the uniqueness factor. It's hard to miss the hundreds of gold rimmed plate-plaques filling the walls floor to ceiling - and the ceiling! You can drink to your delight a pint-sized sampling of a couple hundred *different* beers to claim your own fame-plate on the wall. The contest doesn't stop there. Do the same thing 10 times over (yeah that's something like 2000 pints) and from what I understand you will have earned yourself a trip to some epic beer-bash in Colorado.  Staffed with plaid mini-skirt clad young ladies, the men are always in for the treat of eye candy. They're friendly in here to say the least. Watch for weekly deals such as cheaply priced pints and local brews. Also the food ain't all that bad.

ckAWOhxiRwb3ScjTNDC1Qg.text: Not good for vegetarians.... Nothing too special to me, though the concept is cool. With not a lot of vegetarian options, I had the Hippie Burger and it seemed to be a standard veggie burger patty that you could find at the grocery store. There was not a lot of flavor to my meal which was a disappointment, but at least the food was not over-priced. Would recommend trying a different place if you're vegetarian.

OTQR--WCDEFLhh1-AX39ew.text: Awesome for beer, food and hanging out. I went here on one sunny Saturday. They have outside seating. The ambience sets up the right mood. The staff is very friendly. We had a relaxed lunch.  They serve good pizza and the queso dip was delicious. We had chicken pizza, and it's good. They have huge selection in beer. I am not a beer drinker but I can tell and my friend had a pint of good beer, and was impressed.  The place is big and very spacious.   Overall this place is awesome.

MG3qtiR81OrI_rFWOd0D_g.text: Flying Saucer is one of the first bars that I went to when I  started going to graduate school in Charlotte. It seems to draw a pretty solid college crowd mixed with some older beer drinking fanatics. The space is pretty large and has a huge bar and great outdoor space in the warmer months.   The selection of beer is great - every one is sure to find a beer they love or one they've been wanting to try!   Any time that I have gotten food here it is pretty standard bar food - burger and fries kind of stuff. My favorite is the pretzel appetizer! So for me, I would suggest going here for beer and maybe share a few appetizers more so than dinner or lunch.

SwGt0mAukBZK5Hl-nSOZFg.text: Well it was my first time back here in a good long time- probably close to a year. As you can read from a past update, the service was really sub-par on my last visit. But I wound up meeting a friend for a few drinks and ordered some food.   Even though the place was jam-packed on this particular Thursday night, service was still very quick, and we weren't kept waiting long at any point.   Our server was overly-knowledgeable on the beers, and everything she had recommended was pretty spot on. And not like it was ever bad, but food was a little better than before.   Don't know if they were just having a good night, but they have totallllllyyyyy redeemed themselves in my opinion. And yes, I had to ask about the particular manager from my last encounter and found out she was no longer with them. Added bonus!

gdM8eYOOLWHWbASocvtkIA.text: I ordered a chicken cobb salad and it was middle-of-the-road but pretty expensive for what it was. My friend had the flying saucer burger and liked it for the price. Good selection of beers and decent atmosphere. Just average, overall

hIU9t6obGfFqvf9QRVvYxA.text: I have been to flying saucer a few times now they alway have a great selection and wide variety of beer, from fruity to stouts you can find it here.   Dinged them for a star as the food choices don't have many vegetarian options.

rPvRX_I1OZuB25Pc--cnXA.text: Awesome beer selection with a great staff! Sat at the bar and had a few beers from their very impressive beer list with a burger. Would recommend if you enjoy good beer and bar food. Service was excellent.

amsplZ1Bq1Imn7ohCfwOGA.text: I became a fan of the Saucer years ago, when someone told me that there's beer beyond the Bud. It was here where my love for craft beer began. There are about 300 varieties on hand to choose from and the servers can help guide you through the list.   Speaking of servers, the service is almost always spot on, which makes the experiences that much better.   Get the cheese fries, they're some of the best in town.

OGRrVSog1EEUluEOOU3LBQ.text: I live walking distance from The Saucer, so I frequent the place pretty regularly. A lot of my friends also love the place, so I'm either there with either a group of 4+, or just me and my roommate. Indoors they have lots of booths and tables, and outside on the patio there are wooden picnic tables. The waitresses are all very friendly and know their beer.   I usually just stick to the ciders and Hummingbird Water (raspberry framboise and pear cider) or mixed drinks, since I'm not a beer drinker. It's hard to resist their big soft pretzels, which comes with queso or other dipping sauces. Their pizza is also very good. I haven't tried much of their other food, but my friends say the saucer burger is amazing. They have the UFO club, where you can sign up and try to reach 200 different kinds of beers. (3 per night can be counted toward your total) My roommate signed up and has been working her way through. If you can reach 200, you get a plate with your name on the ceiling/walls. (The establishment is covered in plates, both the name plates and also just decorative plates.)  Some nights it's more crowded than others, but I don't think I've ever had a bad experience. It's a pretty reliable a good time.

MbycKxgRKPyPVudx3mEAeg.text: Tried this place out and it was a nice little date spot. Decent food, decent service. It's fairly quiet mid afternoon which I enjoy.

Rq3J12vqDBKBYy0dzuHnIg.text: Beer, Beer, and well yeah more beer. If you love beer and you want to try every type of beer imaginable, this is the place to go. When you walk through these doors, you will see nothing but plates everywhere. You must ask yourself, what are all these for? Well my friend, these are trophies for those who come here very often and earn it.  Anyways, I came here several times and have been procrastinating on my writing. Thus, here it is: Beer that's unheard of / unknown + Incentive to drink = fun times. Now, they don't only just serve all types of beers but they also have appetizers and food that will accompany your taste in beer to fill you up in that part of your stomach (if the beer didn't fill you up already)  In the end, this place is definitely a place to hang out and just conversate (you'll notice a ton of college students during the school year as UNCC is not even 5 minutes away). Hours will fly by especially if you're curious on what type of beer is good and what isn't. The only problem here I find is that it is a little pricey, especially when you're a heavy drinker. Other than, have a beer or two and join the UFO club and get that plaque!

qpKq8pROlTkrMsMiR8vqyw.text: My husband and I came in for lunch today(Sunday, Jan 1). We sat in a booth across from the bar in the middle of the restaurant. Over a 10 minute time frame, several waitress walked by, waited on tables beside us and across from us. We tried to get their attention 2 x. I finally went up to the waitress station at the bar. I asked 3 waitress if they could take our drink order. One walked off, one looked at her watch and said something to the other  waitress. I pointed to our booth and went to sit down. No one came after a minute or 2, so we left. Oh and it was NOT crowded. We had been regulars here in the past, but this is one reason we quit coming as often. Reconfirmed why we did not come back sooner.

rUlH4wzFGuaASQY-8soTgQ.text: Two things really stood out for me when visiting the Flying Saucer. 1. The beer selection is amazing. Excellent draft selection and a long bottle list. 2. The service is top notch. All the servers were beautiful, attentive, fast, and beer knowledgeable. The food is good but not great. Had the Hippie Burger which was supposed to have a jalapeno pesto. The burger was good but there was no taste of jalapeno at all which is what I was hoping for. The group I was with shared the pretzels (incredible spicy mustard) and the rocket tots. The pretzels were good but the tots were nothing to rave about. The next time I went had the beer and cheese soup and shared a pizza, which again both were good but not great. I would definitely come back again for the beer and service though.

zQXjx_czrENKRChsvELneg.text: The Flying Saucer's beer selection is out of this world. How they also have such good food is completely alien to me. But don't have too many IPA's and nachos or Uranus will go supernova and turn into an all-enveloping black hole.

hhzCeZ7eRo_KjLjB-YkHtQ.text: Mmhmmm. Delicious. Great beer selection. I had the Bleu Burger with goat cheese. Amazing.

10YLHizhuZKdDk-7PgQaVg.text: Fantastic beer choices on tap! I went on a Friday night and the live music really energized the place. Did have a couple of rude encounters with other customers but I'm guessing they had a bit too much to drink.

MwuuVEIozZb6Zuy9gLjyiQ.text: I usually go here just to drink the $3.50 pints on Monday nights, but I occasionally come by during tap takeovers and other such events. There is always an enormous selection of craft beers as well as the mainstream national brands. There are always a plethora of options to choose from, no matter what type of beer drinker you are, novice or (perhaps self-described) expert. Particular attention is paid to local breweries, but beer comes in from across the country and beyond.  The food is almost always excellent. They have a charcuterie board that varies as market dictates, and their pretzels and bratwurst are delicious. Usually I end up ordering a side of fries, which are thin cut and crispy. I will mention that I did have one bad experience with fries where, when questioned, the waitress admitted they had run out and were using grocery store frozen fries. However, I got a full refund and apologies.  The atmosphere is nice, cozy, and interesting people are always milling about. Busy nights include the weekend as well as Monday nights, due to their wonderful $3.50 special, but it's still very easy to hear your friends and get your order in quickly when it's busy.  If you're from the area or live near another Flying Saucer, joining the UFO club is a must. If you get 200 unique check ins for beer bought at the Saucer, you get your name on a plate on the ceiling and a free party with free beer. Can't go wrong.  Parking can get congested on busy nights, but due to its strip mall location, there's always somewhere to park.

kIWpR38rjM4Y7VfeVLV9lA.text: Went here before a concert! Great food, amazing beer selection! Our waitress was so sweet and warned us to put in our food order early because when concerts are going on kitchen gets backed up!!!  Had pretzels, mojo wings and tots! All were excellent! Had beer flight and waitress recommend great ones to! Can't wait to go again!

AlYr9mrwWOGLsm8K8Blm4A.text: It's a great place if you are going for drinks with friends...not that you will be able to hear each other talk, but still. If you are going for food check the score before you walk in! That should tell you enough about what to expect. My friends and I won't eat at restaurants lower than 90%, but once again there is liquor if you can't find it anywhere else....  07/09. Trying it again...hot beer and an 86.5 food score I'll pass on the food and next time on flying saucer as well. It's a shame I have to leave a whole star

Sij84oTue6hTRedib6xueA.text: If you are a beer snob, then this place is for you! Yes their food is wonderful, but when I walked in, that wasn't my focus. When you walk in with beer on you mind, you are greeted by plates all on the ceiling. These are no ordinary plates! These plates hold the names of all that have accomplished tasting just about every beer that has been on tap (they say 200 is when you get you saucer on the ceiling). They have craft beers that are to die for.....rare beers you won't find at very many places. I'll be back tomorrow for the 3.50 pints. Looking forward to it. I may have to get my membership so I can eventually get myself a saucer on the ceiling......CHEERS!

photos.caption: Photo of Flying Saucer Draught Emporium - Charlotte, NC, United States. The view from the booth seats! I love this place!

wuoJfucycHbYIAgAptfaog.text: Oh yeah.  Even the pubs in Dublin aren't as merry.  Lots of beer and menus is mostly german food.    The waitresses are really cute, lots of beer to chose from and the food is good. I had their German plate. It comes with German Potato Salad and it was tangy, warm, and there was some herb in it. Plate came with 2 sausages and a heap of saurkraut. I will likely eat it again.  This place is wonderful. People are relaxing, the beer is cold and the waitresses add to the fun.

XRLsszSM1ugetlihjRr44g.text: They have the best beer cheese soup. I am not a beer drinker, but if you are they have a huge selections.  Service is friendly.

y1uoU5157zj_qu-HQMApbQ.text: I really like this place.  The outside is nice, I just wish inside was a little bigger.  The food was really good as well.

KMf171wXEIzNyz_iyMIEPQ.text: I would avoid this place at all costs. We never received our food after waiting for an hour and 15 minutes. Had to leave and go elsewhere since a waitress or manager never told us how much longer the food would be. Everything we ordered, they were out of.  Everyone around us got their food. Terrible terrible service. Will never be back.

P3WlYkWnn-zoPwqolPFNsA.text: I love the giant pretzels! It comes with two dips. So good! The beer selection is great.

rYOrBR-Wt8qWKECGMB6z9w.text: Beer selection: on-point. Prices: reasonable. Events: fun! trivia, tap takovers, etc. My biggest gripe at this point is the food. When I first started going to Saucer a few years ago in college, I think it was under different management because the menu has changed. They took away my favorite item: the Hippie Hollow, which was an awesome vegetarian option with veggies and either ranch or jalepeno dressing in a pita served with a side (and I always got fries because they were amazing!). The past few times I've gone, I've been limited to the soft preztels, the hippie burger or a salad, none of which are much to write home about. The fries have also gone down hill as well. They are crunchy and flavorless whereas they used to be my favorite and on the level of hot McDonalds fries, but with some salt and pepper too. I'll still come to Saucer for beer and events, but I'd probably grab dinner somewhere else first now.

RsSmg9x067LTjA0AvGa4Sg.text: Just checked this flying saucer out and overall it is very subpar compared to the Raleigh one.  It's in a strip mall with very poor service.  Would not recommend this one to friends.

zXitojEcmIG2arN29E_hxA.text: Great food,  great craft draught selection.   The bartenders and servers are great.   Always a great time.   Never had a bad experience.  Join the UFO club.   Free brunch every Sunday.   Please don't come in and order a Coors light lol

0z87AJH5uvFgllWvrF8Pxw.text: Flying Saucer is a little tricky to find if you're not familiar with the area, but it was worth the effort. In my pre-gluten-free life, I would have really enjoyed the extensive beer selection. They probably had 75-80 beers available. Saucers hung throughout the restaurant celebrate those who have successfully tasted 200 beers at Flying Saucer. OK. I might be off on the number. I think it was 200. I could be wrong.  Since I was unable to enjoy the wide selection of normal beer, I settled for the gluten-free Lakefront New Grist beer. Not bad. It's no Belgian white, but it wasn't bad at all.  The German plate with two brats was delicious. I love a good sauerkraut with a brat, and Flying Saucer definitely hit the mark on both.  More importantly, the wait staff was great. I got to the restaurant about 20 minutes before the rest of my party. The waitress Lauren was more than happy to chat for a couple of minutes while I waited.

2hMRAT3Twbxcm9NiVSI3_w.text: Never going here again! Waited nearly an hour-and-a-half for our food order. Excuses were that 1) they ran out of what we first ordered, then 2) they were busy, then 3) "I'll go check" but never returned, then 4) they gave the order to someone else... but no assurance they were making another order? We left...

LKEZLsuwNSgdrHoxTVEQrQ.text: They have awesome food! That I will say. They also hold brunch, which then they serve breakfast beers which I never thought existed? Their burgers are great, their hummus is fresh, and their grilled cheese and tomato soup is awesome!  My friends and I go here every Monday night and it never ceases to please. Good food, good atmosphere, it's a great place to chill and get a beer or drink. I'm not one for beer, so I usually get a Lambic Framboise, hard cider, or a vodka tonic. I will say don't go to them if you want a good cocktail, it's not their specialty so it won't be as good.  They also hold events there throughout the year celebrating numerous things, so it's always nice to go and see who's there.

H7hspofUDgtt2at6QWspIw.text: Went to Ikea and needed something after 9:00. This was great food and great beer! Fun place! First time I used the app to find somewhere near that was good since we didn't know the area!

YENIZW-tgUi_o8VWBFRZGg.text: Stopped in before a show at PNC Music Pavilion for an indoor tailgate. Beer selection is outstanding - some craft beer joints go for quality and not quantity. Others focus a little too much on local brews. This place has the perfect combo of both. Well thought variety from around the world. And who would have thought the food was good, too?!? The wife had a turkey burger and said it was the best she ever had. She prompted me to write this review. I had a turkey sandwich that was extremely delicious, as well. Bartender was extremely attentive and knowledgeable. Glad I don't live closer. I would give them a lot of my hard-earned $$. Can't wait to come back.

k1sJH3IE9xNnfcMy0BTwyQ.text: This is a cool spot to come before shows at the Charlotte amphitheater, as it is close and has just what you need if you aren't prepped for a long tailgate.   They have a HUGE beer selection.. and apparently if you try all 200 of their beers, you get a gold plate with your name on it on the wall. Granted... this achievement would take some time... but hey, who doesn't like a challenge?   I had one of their Cottonwood pumpkins and it was delicious. I highly recommend that if you like beers of the fall/pumpkin variety.   Our party of 6 shared an array of appetizers that spanned from brat corndogs to pizza to bacon-wrapped jalapenos, in addition to an assortment of dips and such. All were pretty good and did the trick.   All in all, a good stop before a fun show.
